runners.spotlight: Flat ability respected but hasn't looked a natural in two poor runs over hurdles.

runners.name: Secret Pass
runners.comment: Down the field in her two bumpers and can only be watched on this switch to hurdling
runners.spotlight: Down the field in her two bumpers and can only be watched on this switch to hurdling.

runners.name: Old Bridge
runners.breeder: Mrs P Lafitte & Mr A Edwards
runners.comment: Went close on stable debut at Bangor (2m, good) and every chance with a repeat
runners.spotlight: Looks flattered by a BHA mark of 113 but went close on stable debut at Bangor (2m, good) and every chance with a repeat of that; hood worn for all four runs is left off.

runners.name: Impecunious
runners.comment: Won over 2m3f at Chepstow in April and also ran very well over 2m7f there two weeks later
runners.spotlight: Rewarded strong market support when opening account at Chepstow (2m3f, good) last month and backed up that performance with creditable third of 15 there (2m7f, good) a fortnight later; leading contender.

runners.name: Tzarmix
runners.comment: Won a point in April and is well handicapped on some of last year's hurdling form
runners.spotlight: Pulled up after bad jumping error in Cheltenham hunter chase this month but won a point on debut for the Ralph stable in April and is well handicapped on some of last year's hurdling form for the O'Neill stable; a possible.

runners.name: Leading Lion
runners.comment: Pulled up on both stable starts (2m); moves up in trip with a lot to prove
runners.spotlight: Won over 2m4f in Ireland last summer but was pulled up on first two starts for current stable (both 2m); moves up in trip with a lot to prove.

runners.name: Rare Clouds
runners.comment: Inconsistent last year and fell quite heavily on last month's stable debut
runners.spotlight: Seems versatile regarding ground and has slipped to a workable mark but was inconsistent for Simon Earle last year and fell quite heavily on last month's stable debut; others look safer.

runners.name: Hillsin
runners.comment: Placed at Newton Abbot this month; can do better here if more relaxed in early stages
runners.spotlight: Won three in a row for Alan Jones last spring (2m2f-2m4f) and bounced back from poor stable debut when placed at Newton Abbot (2m5f, good) this month; can do better if more relaxed in early stages here; one to consider.

runners.name: Juan Bermudez
runners.comment: Dual course winner last June; yet to hit form for new stable this year
runners.spotlight: Dual novice winner here (2m2f, good) for Dan Skelton last June but started off for Henry Oliver with three underwhelming handicap hurdle runs in March/April (2m3f-2m7f) and has since suffered a heavy defeat on the Flat; needs to get career back on track.

runners.name: Laravie
runners.comment: Only fourth of six in 2m4f Sedgefield handicap this month; new trip and headgear here
runners.spotlight: Came second in Sedgefield maiden (2m4f, good to soft) in February but the form isn't anything to get too excited about and she managed only fourth of six in handicap over that C&D this month; moves up in trip and swaps cheekpieces for first-time visor here.

runners.name: Supreme Yeats
runners.owner: The Old Stag Racing Sy Partnership
runners.comment: Off since September but won this race when fresh on stable debut at year ago
runners.spotlight: Absent since finishing second off today's mark at Worcester (2m4f, good) in September but won this race when fresh on stable debut a year ago (good ground); obvious claims if fully tuned up.

runners.name: Scudamore
runners.comment: Lightly raced since win here in April 2023 but returns from latest layoff on workable mark
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since winning readily by 6l here (2m2f, good to soft) in April 2023 but will be fine over today's longer trip and returns from his latest layoff on a workable mark; market may guide.

stable_tour.quote: He never ran as a two-year-old and showed little at three, but this season he has really stepped up. On his first run of the year, after a 285-day break, he won by six lengths at Southwell and added to that over 1m6f at Chelmsford in the summer. After his most recent start we felt he had an issue that could be resolved with a breathing operation and he seems a happier horse. I am sure that will allow him to go on again and make further progress. He would be one to keep on your side this winter 23-09-21

runners.name: Mactavish
runners.comment: Clear second at Hereford this month, after a break; this longer trip ought to suit better
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner (2m4f-2m5f, good); kept on well for clear second at Hereford (2m3f, good) this month, after a break, and ought to be better suited by this longer trip; big player if that run did him good.

quotes.race: Racing Specials Every Day At PlanetSportBet Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mactavish pricked his ears halfway up the run-in but he does stay three miles so you never really want to hang around on them too much. He's done it well again and he's definitely going in the right direction  - Stan Sheppard, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He prefers a sound surface and will run at Hereford on Wednesday. He's probably at the top end of his mark but he won twice at this time of the year last season. That said, I think with the recent rain the ground might have gone against us now. 28-11-24

runners.name: Zoran
runners.comment: Won his latest hurdling start (September) but not at best on Flat lately; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Scored at Southwell (2m4f, good) on latest hurdling start in November and was also successful on AW in January but didn't fire on the Flat last month and others in this line-up have more pressing claims.

stable_tour.quote: A scopey, athletic colt who did well on the Flat, improving throughout the year. We'll geld him and then get him over hurdles after Christmas. 16-11-20

He's a massive favourite because he loves going to the races, whether you put him in front of a hurdle or a fence or run him on the Flat. He gives his best every time. He's a better Flat horse than he is a jumper but as long as the ground isn't too soft, he'll still pay his way over jumps. We'll mix and match, depending on where the races are. I wouldn't be surprised if he got further than 2m4f over jumps. 29-01-25

runners.name: Land Girls Luck
runners.comment: Has not built upon her maiden win in early April and is not straightforward
runners.spotlight: Won Sedgefield maiden (2m1f, good) in first-time cheekpieces last month but has not really built on that performance in her three subsequent handicaps (2m-2m3f) and is not straightforward; tries new trip here.

quotes.race: Visit The New betvickers.com Website Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Land Girl's Luck ran in a three-runner race at Exeter recently and did her best work late on, so we just thought over two miles we'll ride her really positively and let her use her jumping, because she jumps really well even though she's not the biggest. Max [Comley, trainer] thought the cheekpieces would help and they made a big difference - David Bass, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Getaway With You
runners.comment: Placed on recent stable debut but now 0-18 over hurdles; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: 0-18 over hurdles; placed a few times when trained by Billy Aprahamian and was respectable third for new stable at Worcester (2m4f, good) this month but others appeal more for win purposes; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.name: Stage Show
runners.comment: Bounced back to form and went down fighting when clear second at Taunton last month
runners.spotlight: 0-11 over hurdles but bounced back to form and went down fighting when second at Taunton (2m3f, good to firm) last month; tries a new trip here; can make presence felt if in the right mood again.

runners.name: Bensini
runners.comment: Well beaten this month, after a layoff, and yet to add to his win in July 2023
runners.spotlight: Yet to add to his win in July 2023 and returned from layoff with a disappointing run this month; goes without headgear again today; revival needed.

stable_tour.quote: He'll come back in for a summer campaign as he's been on a winter break. He's a homebred for the owner. I kept trying to step him up in trip but he's probably a two-and-a-half-miler and he'll mix hurdles and fences. He doesn't have the most ability in the world but he tries for you, which is a good start. He needs quick ground. 01-02-24

6:30.race_name: Shirley Guest 80th Birthday Celebration Mares' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle (Div I)

runners.name: Basilette
runners.comment: Never dangerous on handicap debut in December and not seen again since
runners.spotlight: Unexposed over hurdles after only four starts but made low-key handicap debut when never-dangerous seventh at Taunton (2m, good) in December and has not raced again since.

runners.name: Intertwine
runners.comment: Recent handicap debut not devoid of promise (albeit pulled up); tongue-tie added here
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 7yo who was pulled up on her recent handicap debut at Perth (2m4f, good); that run was not devoid of promise but she needs combination of drop back in trip and first-time tongue-tie to enable improvement here.

runners.name: Clear Storm
runners.comment: Placed in all three handicaps and may yet have a bigger run in her; major player
runners.spotlight: Placed in all three handicaps, the last twice at Newton Abbot (2m1f, good/heavy) for new stable this spring; may yet have a bigger performance in her and features prominently in calculations.

runners.name: Window Of Time
runners.comment: Placed off this mark in first two handicaps, the latter this month; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Placed on handicap debut at Southwell in November and kept on well for second when back in action at Huntingdon (also 2m, good) this month; competes off same mark again here; shortlisted.

runners.name: Auntie Maggie
runners.comment: Made all for clearcut Fakenham win two starts ago; held since but remains of interest
runners.spotlight: Came good over hurdles at ninth attempt, making all for wide-margin success at Fakenham last month; managed only fourth when warm favourite to follow up at Ludlow (also 2m, good) three weeks ago but remains of interest.

runners.name: Northern Rose
runners.comment: 0-14 over hurdles but twice went close here last year and made pleasing return last month
runners.spotlight: Close second in this race a year ago and lost out only by a head over 2m2f here (also on good) a few weeks later; fully exposed after 14 hurdling starts but returned from layoff with pleasing Uttoxeter run this month and is sure to be suited by the return to this track.

runners.name: Lusso Milan
runners.comment: Not beaten far at Plumpton three weeks ago but needs to find something extra here
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far when fifth of six at Plumpton (2m, good) three weeks ago but is yet to be placed after six hurdle runs; needs to find something extra here.

runners.name: Penthouse Poppet
runners.comment: 0-11 in Irish points and 0-12 under rules; others look stronger
runners.spotlight: 0-11 in Irish points and 0-12 under rules; ran well to a point over C&D on stable debut in March but two lesser efforts have followed (2m7f/2m6f; cheekpieces refitted last time); others look stronger.

runners.name: Formel Park
runners.comment: Chased home revitalised rival at Ffos Las this month; holds each-way claims at least here
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on handicap debut in November but returned from break with two much better runs this spring, latterly when second to revitalised rival at Ffos Las (2m, good); holds each-way claims at least here.

runners.name: What An Icon
runners.comment: Unseated rider at first flight on recent reappearance outing; now 0-9 over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Unseated rider at first flight on recent reappearance outing and has now been unplaced all nine hurdling starts; 1lb wrong here; sports refitted hood; not the most obvious answer.

7:00.race_name: Shirley Guest 80th Birthday Celebration Mares' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle (Div II)

runners.name: Jos Rainbow
runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles but ran well here last summer and might have needed her recent outing
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles but returned from break when fairly encouraging fifth at Taunton (2m, good to firm; first run after wind op) last month and looks well handicapped if judged on last summer's fourth of 15 over C&D.

stable_tour.quote: She's just arrived at the yard after one run last year in the maiden won by Flight Plan. She'll need further than 7f and could be nice once she steps up in trip. 06-04-23

runners.name: Amberelli
runners.comment: Shaped well before fading on handicap debut (2m5f); drops back in trip here
runners.spotlight: Shaped well before fading into fifth on last month's handicap debut at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft) and has a fighting chance here if suited by the drop back in trip.

runners.name: Pomeriggio
runners.comment: Running well for new stable this spring but not obviously well treated for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish filly who has made the frame in three novice/maiden hurdles (twice over C&D) for new stable this spring; not obviously well treated for this handicap hurdle debut, though, and others appeal more.

runners.name: Fillyfudge
runners.comment: Creditable second to much-improved rival over C&D in March; respected
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner; 0-7 over hurdles but was creditable second to much-improved rival over C&D (good) in March and ran okay when back on the Flat this month; respected.

runners.name: Sadies Diamond
runners.comment: Did not get competitive when back over hurdles for stable debut in March; now 0-16 overall
runners.spotlight: Placed off higher marks over fences for Shark Hanlon last year but did not get competitive when back over hurdles for stable debut in March and overall strike-rate is now 0-16.

runners.name: Masonbrook Meadow

prev_owners.owner: Blind Squirrels Syndicate, M T Pockets Syndicate Et Al
Mrs J Murphy & Blind Squirrels Synd' & M T Pockets Synd'
Blind Squirrels Syndicate, M T Pockets Syndicate Et Al

runners.comment: Safely held on recent handicap hurdle debut; needs that run to have brought her on
runners.spotlight: 0-13 on the Flat and 0-7 over hurdles; made the frame a few times (including over C&D) against own age-group last year but was safely held on recent handicap debut and needs to have taken significant benefit from that outing.

runners.name: Organic
runners.comment: Has not yet shown much over hurdles but Flat form offers hope she can improve
runners.spotlight: Developed into fairly useful Flat racer for George Boughey in 2024 (three wins); soundly beaten in all five hurdle races for new stable this year, the last twice in handicaps, but heavy ground would not have suited on her latest outing (first-time cheekpieces) and there is still hope she can transfer some of that Flat ability to this code; watch the betting.

runners.name: Opticality
runners.comment: Fairly consistent on the Flat and over hurdles for current stable; could have a say here
runners.spotlight: Fairly consistent (albeit without winning) on the Flat and over hurdles for Tim Vaughan since the autumn; dropped another 1lb since this month's Ffos Las fourth (2m, good); could have a say in this.

runners.name: Sweet Serene
runners.comment: Showed no significant promise in her three qualifying runs; handicap debut today
runners.spotlight: Showed no significant promise in her three qualifying runs, the last twice for current stable (2m/2m3f); makes handicap debut from a lowly mark but still needs significant improvement; tongue-tie added.

1:55.race_name: Anglo Printers Remembering John H. Kierans Mares Hurdle

runners.name: Gers Gigi
runners.comment: Mares' maiden hurdle winner last summer; tough ask at these weights today
runners.spotlight: Won a mares' maiden hurdle at Sligo last summer and respectable effort in a handicap off 115 on her penultimate start; tough ask in a mares' novice hurdle at Fairyhouse since though and has another tough assignment at the weights in this contest.

stable_tour.quote: She won a mares' maiden hurdle well at Sligo over the summer and would have gone close to winning at Perth had she not come down at the last. I can see her winning a novice hurdle. 28-10-24

runners.name: Jane Eire
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle win at Cork in November; tough assignments twice since; needs improvement
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden hurdle at Cork in November and has had tough assignments in the big festivals at Cheltenham and Punchestown in last two starts; this is a bit more realistic but she still needs improvement to come out on top.

stable_tour.quote: She's on a break now and will come back in the spring. She was very green in her first couple of runs but was really good the other day when winning at Cork. It might be a bit ambitious but I'd like to aim her towards the mares' novice hurdle at Cheltenham. She's owned by a great bunch and they never shirk a trip. 18-11-24

runners.name: Maughreen
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner; excuse at Cheltenham; shaped like 2m may be okay at Fairyhouse since
runners.spotlight: Punchestown bumper winner on debut and winning return in a maiden hurdle back there in January this year; lost ground at the start in the Dawn Run at Cheltenham but was only a distant fifth in the Grade 1 Honeysuckle mares' novice hurdle at Fairyhouse last month; travelled well for a long way in that race and drop in trip here may help but gives weight to a rival with a higher rating (Royal Eagle).

quotes.race: 50,000 Euros BetVictor Graduation Bonus Series Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maughreen put up a huge performance for a mare having just her second run. She went out and made her own running, jumped from hurdle to hurdle, made a couple of little mistakes including at the last when Paul was happy to let her fiddle it - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Flat Race
quotes.quote: Maughreen was very professional, settled great, quickened up well and handled the ground great. Her work had been good but that is probably better than what she had been doing at home. The owners are entitled to get a bit excited, especially with that pedigree - Patrick Mullins, rider

stable_tour.quote: She put in a huge performance the other day and jumped like a handicapper. She was taking on a very experienced horse in Familiar Dreams. Cheltenham is going to be a tough ask for a horse having her second run over hurdles, but since we started schooling her everyone said she was a brilliant jumper. She's our top mares' novice. 5-2-25

runners.name: Royal Eagle
runners.owner: David Monaghan & Adam Lord & Paddy Monaghan
runners.comment: 2nd in the Listed races last season and probably needed recent return; sets the standard
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two Listed mares' hurdles last season including a narrow defeat to Jetara at Limerick (2m7f, good) in October before a 10l defeat at Wetherby; sets the standard on those runs and probably needed her return at Killarney on the back of six months off earlier this month; leading claims.

quotes.race: William Hill Pick Your Places Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Royal Eagle did it snugly enough I think and there should be plenty more to come from her. They will have lots of fun with her over the summer months - Lisa O'Neill, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Perennial Freight Handicap
quotes.quote: Royal Eagle is very versatile and was good in Galway, she is a very slick jumper and hopefully there will be a bit more to come under both codes - Sam Ewing, rider

stable_tour.quote: I'd say that was almost the best run of her life at Limerick last weekend in that Listed hurdle. In another stride she might have got up. Hopefully, she can pick up one of those this season. She deserves to. 28-10-24

2:30.race_name: Join The Listowel Races Supporters Club Maiden Hurdle

runners.name: Boy Gin Go
runners.comment: Pulled up in a point and was tailed off when 150-1 for rules debut
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in a point and was tailed off when 150-1 for rules debut.

runners.name: Cabaret Prince
runners.breeder: R D & J S Chugg & Millhouse Stud
runners.comment: Point winner; not beaten far on rules debut but backwards step since; drops back in trip
runners.spotlight: Point winner who wasn't beaten far on rules debut at Leopardstown in March; mixed signals on the strength of that form and well held over 2m4f 19 days ago; return to this sort of trip may help but has a bit to find.

runners.name: Complete Fiction
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Won off 74 on Flat in Aug'; return to timber encouraging but form knocked; off 207 days
runners.spotlight: Winner off 74 on the Flat last summer and return to hurdles was promising when runner-up at Fairyhouse in November; form knocked since but lightly raced in this sphere; off 207 days.

quotes.race: Hartes Group Apprentice Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Complete Fiction had a nice run in Leopardstown the other night and he bounced out of it well. He was very consistent last year and went up too much, and he just needed to come back down in grade - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Caulfield Industrial Handicap
quotes.quote: We were a bit worried about whether COMPLETE FICTION would handle the track or not but he handled it well and came home well as he usually does. Colin is champion jockey for a reason and he was brilliant. We needed that extra distance beyond the mile and he excels at 1m1f. He has little snippets of form on soft ground, he wasn't beaten that far in a few handicaps last year. We were half confident he might handle the ground but we were worried about the hill as everyone does. It all worked out perfect. It was a brilliant ride - Jarlath Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Golf Course & Driving Range Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Complete Fiction is at a level and if we can keep him in that area he might pick up another race. A lot of times it's down to himself, what he decides during the race, whether he'll go for it or not - Jarlath Fahey, trainer

quotes.race: Manguard Plus Handicap
quotes.quote: Complete Fiction is a big mystery. He never fails to spark on the gallop and never fails to disappoint on the track. I told Rory going out if he sparked he would get a great spin. If he stays in the right frame of mind he could win one or two more - Jarlath Fahey, trainer

runners.name: Diamond Jimmy
runners.comment: Shown very little at huge odds in two starts so far and has been off 248 days
runners.spotlight: Shown very little at huge odds in two starts so far and has been off 248 days.

runners.name: Dream Diamond
runners.comment: Placed in 2 maiden hurdles in 2024; back to form with 1l defeat latest; standard setter
runners.spotlight: Hit the frame in two maiden hurdles towards the end of 2024 and bounced back from two lesser runs in bumpers when beaten roughly 1l at Killarney 20 days ago back over timber; front three pulled clear (re-opposing Wholelotofbusiness runner-up) and he's amongst the standard setters; ought to go well and Ewing retains the ride.

runners.name: Iceteem Flechois
runners.comment: Unseated in a point six days ago and best watched on rules debut here
runners.spotlight: Unseated in a point six days ago and best watched on rules debut here.

runners.name: Jetaway Sheldon
runners.comment: Tough ask for a newcomer and suspicion he may want a bit further than this
runners.spotlight: Jet Away gelding; dam point winner, half-sister to bumper and 2m3f-3m1f hurdle/chase winner Charter Ridge; this looks like a tough ask for a newcomer and suspicion he may want a bit further than this.

runners.name: Marfa
runners.comment: Vendangeur gelding; half-brother to 5 winners inc' O Maonlai; fair pedigree; check market
runners.spotlight: Vendangeur gelding; half-brother to five winners including O Maonlai (bumper and smart 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase), Flirtatious Girl (Listed bumper) and Autumn Shades (2m2f hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to useful 2m7f-3m1f chase winner Late Romantic; likeable pedigree and worth a market check.

runners.name: Sonnyboyliston
runners.comment: Classy on Flat; 6 wins inc' 2021 Ebor/Irish Leger; off 3 years before 2 below par Flat runs
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner on the Flat including the Ebor and Irish St Leger in 2021; off nearly three years and has been a long way below his best in two subsequent runs on the level for new yard; interesting switched to this sphere and wouldn't need to transfer all of his Flat ability to be a factor on hurdle bow; market may provide clues.

quotes.race: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Sonnyboyliston never disappoints and I thought he did very well to win today. It looked like a proper race and he had a good position all the way. He comes off the bridle but I thought from two furlongs out Ben looked confident on him. He got in a battle but he never lacks in a battle - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Ebor Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: The last time Sonnyboyliston ran here he ran very well. They went slow and he got outpaced but I loved the way he came home. Ronan Whelan said he would come on for the run, which gave us great confidence. The Melbourne Cup had been the next plan but I have him in the Irish St Leger and we'll have to seriously think about that first - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Northfields" Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Sonnyboyliston was the horse I was most excited about this weekend. The cheekpieces helped him concentrate. He's a big baby and still learning, we might give him a run in a Listed race to see where he fits in - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Sentinel Ireland Equine Products Handicap
quotes.quote: He's progressing well. I thought he was a little bit unlucky at Navan the last time. Ben said he made his own bit of bad luck today as he wasn't travelling through the race. When he got him to the outside he stayed on well and got the trip well. I think it's a good trip for him at the minute but he might be a horse that gets a mile-and-a-half in time - Johnny Murtagh, trainer of Sonnyboyliston

quotes.race: It's Not Rocket Science With MansionBet Handicap
quotes.quote: He was good, jumped well and travelled well. He probably wants a bit further but did it well. He liked the ground and handled the track well. It was his first handicap and he was still a bit green, but he's a nice horse going forward. Johnny's [Murtagh] horses are flying so hopefully we can keep it going - Ben Coen, rider of Sonnyboyliston

runners.name: The Happy Huntsman
runners.comment: Idaho gelding; dam multiple point/3m hunter chase winner; newcomer probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Idaho gelding; dam multiple point/3m hunter chase winner, half-sister to winners Uberman (2m chase) and Super Sid (2m hurdle), out of dual bumper and 2m hurdle/2m5f chase winner; newcomer probably best watched.

runners.name: Wholelotofbusiness
runners.comment: Jolt of improvement when a neck in front of Dream Diamond; possible slower ground here
runners.spotlight: Well held in two runs at Limerick in 2023-24 season but jolt of improvement on return to action 20 days ago, beaten half a length at Killarney with re-opposing Dream Diamond a neck behind; the front three pulled a long way clear of their rivals and that's the best jumps form on offer; needs to prove himself on slower ground if the rain comes and the bounce factor is a small concern but could also come on for the run; shortlisted.

runners.name: Encosta
runners.comment: Dual Flat winner who has shown ability in 2 hurdle starts; will need further progress
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner who has shown ability in two runs over hurdles; will need further progress to be a factor here but that's possible on just her third run over timber.

runners.name: Willuhaveamineral
runners.comment: Milan mare; dam well held in 2 maiden hurdles half-sister to 3 hurdle winners; interesting
runners.spotlight: Milan mare; dam well held in two maiden hurdles, half-sister to winners Rosmuc Relay (2m3f-2m4f hurdle/chase), Shes Flat Tothemat (2m-2m4f hurdle/chase) and Victoria Milano (2m/2m5f hurdle); interesting newcomer but may want a bit further than this.

runners.name: Ask Phil
runners.comment: Tailed off in both runs so far and best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Distant fifth in a maiden hurdle on debut and failed to build on that when tailed off again at Cork three weeks ago; best watched for now.

runners.name: Ballinaboola Jet
runners.comment: Fell on debut in 2022; tailed off in bumper on return from lengths absence only run since
runners.spotlight: Fell on debut in 2022 and tailed off in a bumper on return from lengths absence on only run since.

runners.name: Ballyharney
runners.comment: Distant 3rd in maiden hurdle on debut and has been off 228 days; needs more
runners.spotlight: Distant third of eight in a maiden hurdle at Punchestown on last season's debut; off 228 days and needs major step forward.

runners.name: Corbally Cross
runners.comment: Point winner on back of an absence last month but form let down since; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Point winner on the back of an absence last month but form let down since and others appeal more.

runners.name: Fancy A Tipple
runners.comment: 16s for debut and finished tailed off; stoutly bred and may not want shorter trip
runners.spotlight: 16s for debut at Cork in a maiden hurdle three weeks ago and finished tailed off (10th of 13); stoutly bred and drop in trip may not help.

runners.name: Gaoithe Glory
runners.comment: 2nd in course bumper on debut; lesser runs in 2 bumpers since; further may help
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a course bumper on his debut in September (form boosted by winner since) but lesser efforts in two subsequent bumpers; step up in trip may help get him back on track.

runners.name: Golden Reel
runners.comment: Showed ability on Flat in 2023; nothing at huge odds in 3 hurdle runs; another new yard
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability on the Flat in 2023; nothing at huge odds in three maiden hurdle runs later that year and poor run no the Flat on sole start for Conor O'Dwyer in 2024; another new yard and has plenty to prove.

runners.name: Kara Sacre
runners.comment: Point winner who has run with credit in 2 rules starts and step up in trip likely to suit
runners.spotlight: Point winner who only found one too good in a maiden hurdle at Naas last month and ran to a similar level when third of 18 at Down Royal earlier this month, possibly doing too much too soon; step up in trip likely to suit and looks like a big player in this field.

runners.name: Political Stance
runners.comment: Never involved when tailed off 66-1 shot on debut; not sure to appreciate drop in trip
runners.spotlight: Never involved when tailed off at 66-1 for his debut at Tipperary 17 days ago; not sure to appreciate this drop in distance and others look more likely.

runners.name: Qaasid
runners.owner: Four Fools & A Fast Horse Syndicate
runners.comment: 5-time Flat winner rated 91 in that sphere; hasn't transferred that ability to hurdles
runners.spotlight: Five-time Flat winner rated 91 in that sphere; hasn't really transferred that ability to this sphere and has a bit to find here.

stable_tour.quote: He is a Shadwell-bred gelding and although he's only got his head in front twice he has run consistently well and is a hard horse to criticise as he tries every time. He's in the same bracket as Dingle in that he will be a good all-weather horse this winter - all of his wins have been on the all-weather. He'll be ready to resume again in December and hopefully give us a lot of fun. 06-09-23

runners.name: Reiki Revolution
runners.comment: Galway bumper winner; encouraging yard debut on hurdle bow but jumping needs to improve
runners.spotlight: Left his debut behind when winning a Galway bumper in October and was out of his depth in Listed class at Cheltenham on final start for Shark Hanlon; wasn't disgraced when fourth of five at Killarney 19 days ago but jumping needs to improve to be a factor here.

runners.name: Rhythmic Tune
runners.comment: Tailed off when 50-1 for his debut at Cork three weeks ago and needs to leave that behind
runners.spotlight: Tailed off when 50-1 for his debut at Cork three weeks ago and needs to leave that run behind.

runners.name: Simple Old Game
runners.comment: Shown very little in trio of point starts and looks up against it on rules bow
runners.spotlight: Shown very little in trio of point starts and looks up against it on rules bow.

runners.name: Sticktotheplan
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Lieu Des Champs
runners.comment: 8th in Punchestown bumper; shaped like this trip may help when 2nd in maiden hurdle since
runners.spotlight: Showed more when eighth in a Punchestown festival bumper; turned over when favourite for a Kilbeggan maiden hurdle 15 days ago and gave the impression he would relish a return to further; warrants respect.

runners.name: Tinking Man
runners.comment: Best of 6 point runs came when 3rd last month; not sure to appreciate 2m4f on yard debut
runners.spotlight: Best of six point runs came when third last month; not sure to appreciate drop in trip on yard debut.

runners.name: Pistocchi
runners.comment: Never involved when 80s on debut but stayed on okay and may appreciate further
runners.spotlight: Never involved when 80-1 for Cork debut three weeks ago but stayed on okay; should appreciate further and may outrun his likely odds.

runners.name: Seeitoldya
runners.comment: Point winner; beaten fav in a bumper on rules debut but longer trip will help
runners.spotlight: Point winner in March but was a well beaten 2-1 favourite for a 2m2f Tipperary bumper earlier this month; longer trip will help now tackling hurdles and one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Glorytogod Tom
runners.comment: Hasn't backed up a maiden hurdle success in November 2023 in five runs since
runners.spotlight: Hasn't backed up a maiden hurdle success in November 2023 in five runs since and tailed off at Gowran when last seen.

runners.name: River Vale

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Point winner; went close at Limerick in Dec'; not much went right at Naas; 2m4f will suit
runners.spotlight: Point winner who went close at Limerick over Christmas; not much went right at Naas last time and will relish the return to further.

runners.name: Knockbrack Rambler
runners.comment: Beat River Vale at Limerick but nothing twice since; rain may help
runners.spotlight: Got the better of River Vale at Limerick over Christmas but has shown nothing in two runs since including when tailed off last at Ballinrobe last month; rain would help his chance but needs a career best to defy this mark.

quotes.race: Racing Home For Easter Festival 30th March To 1st April Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Knockbrack Rambler got a great ride from Cal who just waited and waited. The ground was maybe too soft the last day, not as deep today. We might go again in a couple of weeks - Brendan Walsh, trainer.

runners.name: A Nod To Getaway
runners.comment: 1-22 under rules; more consistent than most; up 3lb but one of these should fall his way
runners.spotlight: Just 1-22 under rules but more consistent than most and only beaten a neck at Wexford a fortnight ago; up 3lb and has a career high mark but one of these should fall his way and both slower ground and a longer trip are fine; one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Aboy Joey
runners.comment: 14-race maiden and didn't seem to see out this new trip strongly at Cork three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden and didn't seem to see out this new trip strongly at Cork three weeks ago; questions to answer.

runners.name: Vintage Gold
runners.comment: Sole win came at this sort of trip; may have needed return and in good form end of 2024
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over this sort of trip at Killarney in August 2023; running well in defeat from this sort of mark at the end of 2024 and may have needed this month's return at Tipperary; some rain would be in his favour.

runners.name: Mellem
runners.comment: 0-11; only beaten 1l latest and up 2lb but may not appreciate rain
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; beaten roughly 1l at Cork (2m4f, good) three weeks ago and is up 2lb; not the strongest form and may not appreciate rain.

runners.name: The Mass Path
runners.comment: 0-17; pulled up in claimer 16 days ago and best form on good ground; hasn't shown enough
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden under rules and pulled up in a claimer 16 days ago; best form on good ground and hasn't shown enough over timber in the last 12 months.

runners.name: Anysignofhim
runners.comment: Tailed off in 3 maiden hurdles and didn't kick on in h'cap hurdles; entitled to need this
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in trio of maiden hurdles and didn't really kick on in handicap hurdles; entitled to need this after 235 days off; cheekpieces on.

runners.name: Bal Kauto
runners.comment: Hat-trick in 2023; missed 2024 but signs of return to form at Bellewstown last time
runners.spotlight: Hat-trick in 2023 before missing 2024; signs of a return to form at Bellewstown last month and back on a good mark if he can build on that; versatile with regards to conditions.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better At Downpatrick Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Bal Kauto is a lovely, sharp horse and jumps like a cat. We'll see how he comes out of it, he's in again at Wexford on Tuesday - Declan Queally, trainer.

runners.name: Olord
runners.comment: Still maiden but major return to form with Tipperary 2nd and major player back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but major return to form when second of 15 at Tipperary 17 days ago; wasn't seen to best effect that day and he's a major player back up in trip, despite a 3lb rise.

runners.name: Handy Manny
runners.comment: Poor rules form last year and shown nothing in two recent points
runners.spotlight: Poor rules form last year and shown nothing in two recent points.

runners.name: Party Pack
runners.comment: Failed to complete in 3 of last 4 starts and hard to make case for; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete in three of his last four starts and hard to make a case for on anything he's achieved so far; wears first-time tongue-tie.

runners.name: Mister Persistence
runners.comment: Tailed off in last three handicap hurdles and same story on chase debut last week
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in last three handicap hurdles and same story on chase debut last week; remains best watched.

runners.name: Toor Moon
runners.comment: 0-24; one of his better runs when 6th this month; should appreciate step back up in trip
runners.spotlight: 24-race maiden; one of his better efforts when sixth of 16 at Tipperary earlier this month and should appreciate step back up in trip but vulnerable for win purposes.

runners.name: Lariat

prev_owners.owner: Stars In The Sun Racing Syndicate
Gary Devlin & N W T Dalzell & Fred Rusk

runners.comment: Just one Flat win since 2018 and 0-22 over timber; struggling when last seen; new yard
runners.spotlight: Just one win since 2018 and that came on the Flat in 2022; 0-22 over timber and struggling when last seen for John McConnell.

quotes.race: EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Lariat is a nice horse and that was a workmanlike performance, he learned a lot from his first run. His brother was a very nice, consistent middle-distance horse who won a Derby trial and he's got the same frame of mind so I hope he can go on - David Probert, jockey.

runners.name: Ardfert Mary
runners.comment: 0-20; signs he may be capable from this mark in 2 runs last month; may not want rain
runners.spotlight: 0-20 under rules but signs she may be capable from this sort of mark in a couple of runs last month; may not want rain to arrive.

runners.name: Lauro Lady
runners.comment: Struggled in maiden hurdles and well held on handicap debut 17 days ago
runners.spotlight: Struggled in maiden hurdles and well held on handicap debut 17 days ago.

runners.name: Matties Mountain
runners.comment: Losing run since 2020; signs of return to form with Tipperary fourth 17 days ago; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; losing run since 2020 but signs of a return to form with a Tipperary fourth 17 days ago.

runners.name: Dylans Chance
runners.comment: 0-8 and nothing to recommend him so far; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 0-8 and nothing to recommend him so far.

runners.name: Shing Shilla
runners.breeder: Lynch Bages Ltd & Edge Ridge Ltd
runners.comment: One of her better runs at Ballinrobe earlier this week but others look stronger; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; one of her better runs at Ballinrobe earlier this week but others look stronger; engaged at Tramore on Friday.

runners.name: Littlebiggie
runners.comment: Trip/ground okay and runs well fresh; drops in grade
runners.spotlight: Killarney maiden hurdle winner a year ago and several solid efforts in defeat over various trips, notably second in quite valuable 2m7f Killarney handicap; too keen and stiff enough task when last seen in 2m7f Limerick mares Listed in October; trip/ground okay and runs well fresh; drops in class.

runners.name: Cafe Con Leche
runners.owner: Anthony David Bustin & Paul Mc Kernan & Aisling Mccarthy
runners.comment: On a competitive mark but hard to be confident in right now
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over timber, all on soft/heavy, the latest at Cork in December 2023; went close back there in March over 2m4f (good) but both runs since have been poor, latest when never sighted after slow start at Clonmel; on a competitive mark but hard to be confident in right now.

quotes.race: Follow Limerick Racecourse On Facebook Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cafe Con Leche has got a lot stronger and he is more effective in a finish now than he used to be. He's an improver, he's developing, and it was probably a blessing in disguise that he didn't get into the Boodles - Denis Hogan, trainer/rider

quotes.race: Rosegreen Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cafe Con Leche just followed the favourite before that one just stopped. He was rated to win this. He's quite versatile as to ground. We might just take our time with him for now - Denis Hogan, trainer-rider

runners.name: West Cork Wildway
runners.comment: Back hurdling off 7lb lower than his chase mark but vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler/chaser in his day; returned to point-to-points in December, notably second in opens at Belharbour and Kildorrery before just okay run in 2m4f Cork hunters chase last month; back hurdling off 7lb lower than his chase mark but vulnerable.

quotes.race: BetVictor Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: West Cork Wildway was very good today. He learned from his mistake at Killarney and he is a nice horse going forward. He'll give us a few more good days out hopefully - Paul O'Flynn, trainer.

quotes.race: Boomerang.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He hadn't run in a while but Paul (O'Flynn) thought he'd run well. He's not a bad horse. I thought that was a nice race. He can be a bit funny with his head at times. I think he might progress further chasing - rider Darragh O'Keeffe.

quotes.race: Season Finale INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: He's a very nice horse with a good pedigree. Any horse who can win a four-year-old maiden first time out obviously has a fair level of ability and he won a winners' race too. After a break, he ran very well in a nice maiden hurdle at Listowel, beaten by two decent horses, and he was well entitled to do what he did today. I think the owners had an offer to sell him after his point-to-point but they're a big syndicate and I think they felt they'd rather have some fun with him. You'd look forward to him in a maiden hurdle after that, he's a very athletic jumper - Eoin O'Brien, rider of West Cork Wildway

runners.name: Howdoyalikeherhome
runners.comment: Steadily progressive novice handicapper; blinkers now tried and more possible
runners.spotlight: Off the mark on third start for Gordon Elliott in a novice handicap at Down Royal (2m5f, good) last month and solid run off 4lb higher when third at Killarney; blinkers now tried.

runners.name: Gold Speed

prev_owners.owner: Anthony F McLoughlin & Sean Coyne & Conor McLoughlin

runners.comment: C&D winner in 2023; handicapper relenting and cheekpieces now tried but opposable
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner, whose last win came over C&D in September 2023 off 118; lightly raced since, most recently after 159-day absence when no threat over inadequate 2m at Punchestown festival early this month; handicapper relenting and cheekpieces now tried but opposable.

quotes.race: GVA Donal O'Buachalla Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gold Speed did everything unintentionally to get himself beat! He jumped poorly and ran very free, but I would say he has a very high level of ability which got him through. If he put everything together he could be quite a good horse - Sean Flanagan, rider.

quotes.race: Connolly's Red Mills Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We'll take things slowly with him. He had a capped hock earlier in his career but thank God he seems to be going well now. He's keen but he seemed to relax as the race went. We'll look for a small race somewhere - Adrian Murray, trainer

runners.name: Free Flow
runners.breeder: Jeffrey K Ramsey, Stephanie E Ramsey & William K Ramsey
runners.comment: Thurles maiden winner has ground to suit; player if staying longer trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Built on encouraging runs in maidens when comfortably winning at Thurles (2m, good) in March, albeit helped by main challenger blundering at last (runner-up has won since); yard back among the winners at Wexford on Wednesday and good chance on handicap debut if staying longer trip.

runners.name: Rockstown Girl
runners.comment: Unseated early on recent chase debut and back hurdling here off a fair mark
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner and 2-9 over hurdles, latest win in 2m4f novice at Chepstow in October; unseated early on recent chase debut at Wexford and back hurdling here off a fair mark.

quotes.race: Capital Windscreens In Memory Of Aaron Jones EBF Mares' "National Hunt" Novices Hurdle (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Rockstown Girl was suited by the step up in trip. She had some smart bumper form and we might look to see if there is something for her at Cheltenham's November meeting - Anthony McCann, trainer.

runners.name: Long Gone
runners.comment: Recent Tramore maiden winner with trip/ground to suit on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won Limerick bumper a year ago and off the mark over hurdles in 2m Tramore mares maiden last month in gutsy style after making most; seems to like decent ground and stays 2m4f so respected on handicap debut; due to run at Limerick Thursday (7.12).

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I probably took a bit of a risk running Long Gone back over this trip but it was a 15 grand race and you've the bonus too so Gilmer (Bates, owner) said to take a chance. We got a little bit of luck on the day with the two fallers. We'll look to step up in trip now for a novice. Ideally, she'd want two miles four and five. She showed a good attitude and stayed, she was flat out the whole way - Declan Queally, trainer.

runners.name: Meet My Loreley
runners.comment: A work in progress and could have more to offer entering handicap company; yard in form
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner who landed a Navan bumper in 2023; 0-6 hurdling but useful level of form in maidens over various trips; still looks a work in progress and could have more to offer entering handicap company; yard had a double at Ballinrobe during the week.

runners.name: Brilliant Light
runners.comment: C&D second last September; better for recent comeback run so don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Classy on the Flat and rated 93; 1-6 over hurdles, the win coming in a Worcester novice last September (2m, good); went close off 107 over C&D last September and expected to come on for last month's comeback run (fresh) at Down Royal; don't rule out.

quotes.race: Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Brilliant Light was coming back from a mile and a half and I wanted to bowl along, but he didn't have the speed. He needed every yard of that mile and a quarter. He's a big, strong horse who wants good ground and he coped with today fine - he wouldn't want to be running somewhere with firm in the description - Hector Crouch, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Lightly raced all-weather and turf winner who impressed on his first three starts in Britain but got rather stuck in the mud on his last outing. We see him as a progressive type who should do well on a sounder surface. He could reappear in the Listed Zabeel Turf on January 28 and work his way up the ratings thereafter. 20-01-21

runners.name: Down Around
runners.comment: Well held in valuable Punchestown contest latest; trip/ground to suit and drops in grade
runners.spotlight: Won over this trip at Thurles in November (good) off 99 and solid runs off revised mark until well held in very competitive contest at Punchestown festival last time; drops in grade.

runners.name: Spring Meadow
runners.comment: Limerick winner has disappointed twice since; yard respected here but may just need this
runners.spotlight: Two-time winner over hurdles, the latest off 99 over this trip at Limerick in October (good); unruly at the start next time when well held and again soundly beaten when last seen in January; yard respected here but may just need this.

runners.name: Fast Felix
runners.comment: Improvement needed from handicap debut in valuable 2m1f Killarney contest; 2m4f may suit
runners.spotlight: Placed form in maidens but now 0-8 hurdling and plenty of improvement needed from recent handicap debut effort in valuable 2m1f Killarney contest; return to 2m4f may suit.

runners.name: Miss Corby
runners.owner: Mrs T Hyde & Mrs Paul Shanahan
runners.comment: Ballinrobe maiden winner could improve again for this longer trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced mare came good on third maiden hurdle run when taking 2m1f Ballinrobe mares contest last month, possibly not suited by tight track but never stronger than at the finish; good chance she'll find more at this longer trip and respected on handicap debut with capable claiming amateur booked.

runners.name: Duty Bound
runners.comment: Excuses latest but still others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won sole start over fences at Wexford last August (2m4f); 0-8 hurdling, latest run at Fairyhouse had excuse when badly hampered two out; others preferred.

runners.name: Carlas Big Jim
runners.comment: Chasing of late; of limited appeal back hurdling on this quicker ground.
runners.spotlight: Both hurdle wins early last year were on heavy, at Clonmel and Gowran; largely chasing of late and generally struggled; of limited appeal back hurdling on this quicker ground.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back On Every Race At Cheltenham Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Carlas Big Jim probably got an easy lead, but he acts well on that ground. Cal knows him very well and he says he jumps better when he's up there. We might run him next in a qualifier for the Full Circle Series at Cork - Louis Archdeacon, trainer.

runners.name: Chefs Kiss
runners.comment: Limerick third his best run yet; ground to suit but 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner on heavy but handles good ground, most recently last month (well-backed favourite) in 2m3f Limerick handicap hurdle when third; hard to make out his best trip and more needed off 3lb higher here.

runners.name: Ballinoe Blaze
runners.comment: Penultimate Limerick run encouraging but likely more needed to play major role
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden produced his best handicap run on penultimate start at Limerick (2m6f, good) when third of 8 off 97; didn't back that up at Cork on latest so needs to step forward to play a major role here.

runners.name: Cregane Ned
runners.comment: Behind throughout on recent comeback run after 427-day absence; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Veteran hasn't added to Clonmel maiden win of four years ago; very interrupted campaign in recent years, behind throughout on recent comeback run after 427-day absence; can only be watched.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cregane Ned has loads of ability but he just needs to relax a bit. He works really well at home, but the main thing is getting him settled. Hopefully he can pick up another one - Paul O'Flynn, trainer

runners.name: Kilfera
runners.comment: Doesn't appeal as one to make an immediate impact in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Hasn't troubled the judge in five maiden attempts over various trips, not entirely discredited on latest after being hampered at Killarney; room for improvement in jumping and doesn't appeal as one to make an immediate impact in handicaps though bred to stay.

runners.name: Love Like This
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden hard to fancy on the back of two poor recent efforts
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 25 starts but running well enough at times mixing hurdles and fences, notably when runner-up over hurdles at Ballinrobe (2m6f, good) last month; two poor efforts since however.

runners.name: Tackletommywoowoo
runners.comment: Potential improved now upped in trip on second handicap attempt
runners.spotlight: Couple of good efforts in British bumpers when trained by Sam Drinkwater; well held for new yard in a couple of maidens and midfield on handicap debut at Kilbeggan; step up in trip here could bring improvement.

runners.name: Foxy Rock
runners.comment: Not much in maidens but blinkers and longer trip could eke out improvement on handicap bow
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to the useful Foxy Jacks has been beaten 30l on last two maiden runs over staying trips; bred to do better in time and blinkers fitted here for handicap debut.

runners.name: Alright Darling
runners.comment: Back up in trip here and handicapper relenting but remains high enough
runners.spotlight: Remote 2m4f Leopardstown fourth was a step in the right direction but never landed a blow over 2m3f at Naas; back up in trip here and handicapper relenting but still high enough mark on what she's achieved.

runners.name: Fill The Tank
runners.comment: 10lb lower than last winning mark but lacks a recent run and others preferred
runners.spotlight: Three hurdle wins all at around 3m, latest in September 2023 off 100; regressive last year and first run since November.

runners.name: Dunany Point
runners.comment: Progressive 6yo and could have more upside than many of these so considered
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in fine style when making all off 81 at Bellewstown (2m5f, good) last month and solid second at Sligo off 7lb higher since; progressive and could have more upside than many of these so considered.

runners.name: Jekiki
runners.comment: Mildly encouraging run at Clonmel (2m4f) latest; much more needed
runners.spotlight: Not too much to recommend since joining from Jessica Harrington, mildly encouraging run at Clonmel (2m4f) latest; much more needed; also due to run at Limerick Thursday (7.42).

runners.name: Lough Nigara
runners.comment: Too keen on Wexford comeback; hood on and back to a longer trip, could go well if settling
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles for Matthew Daly but has shown ability over this sort of trip; favourite on yard debut at Wexford a fortnight ago but keen and didn't get home after making most (2m1f); hood fitted and back to a longer trip here, could go well if settling better.

runners.name: Inchidaly Copper
runners.comment: Improving handicap chaser looks thrown in here off 23lb lower hurdles mark
runners.spotlight: Improving handicap chaser won at Killarney (3m) in October and followed up on return early this month at Tipperary, coping well with considerable drop in trip (2m1f) rallying after mistake last; looks thrown in here off 23lb lower hurdles mark and ground to suit.

quotes.race: I.P.R.S. Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Inchidaly Copper is s lovely horse to ride. He was winging fences all the way round. He's a nice horse - Andrew Burke-Ott, rider

runners.name: Sir Carnegie
runners.comment: Placed at Down Royal over slightly shorter but hasn't backed that up; cheekpieces tried
runners.spotlight: Placed at Down Royal over slightly shorter (good) but hasn't backed that up twice since; cheekpieces now tried.

runners.name: Barryroe Madam
runners.comment: Running a career-best when unseating at the last at Naas; chance off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Now 0-14 hurdling, though in the process of running a career-best when unseating at the last at Naas over 3m last time; chance off the same mark.

runners.name: Three Tribes
runners.comment: Opening three handicap efforts haven't amounted to much; upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Opening three handicap efforts haven't amounted to much; upped in trip.

runners.name: Better Than Heaven
runners.comment: Better for recent comeback after huge lay-off; tongue-tie tried and market best guide
runners.spotlight: Won 2m4f Navan handicap way back in June 2021 (good) but very limited opportunities since, returning from 1254-day absence when never sighted at Cork last month; tongue-tie tried and market best guide.

runners.name: Max Time
runners.comment: Galway winner off 2lb higher but hard to be confident in after recent run
runners.spotlight: Won off 80 at Galway last September (2m6f, good-to-yielding) but soundly beaten on last month's comeback run; hood now tried but not one to be confident in.

runners.name: Rewrite The Script
runners.comment: Now 0-15 hurdling and continues to struggle off lowly marks in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Now 0-15 hurdling and continues to struggle off lowly marks in handicaps.

5:20.race_name: Oliver Broderick (Pro/Am) Fillies INH Flat Race

runners.name: Another Blunder
runners.comment: Cheaply bought daughter of Order Of St George likely all the better for this debut run
runners.spotlight: Order Of St George filly cost 4,000 euros as a foal; first foal; dam 1m2f-1m4f winner (inc AW; RPR 72)/runner-up 2m hurdle; likely all the better for this debut run.

runners.name: Baile Mhisteala
runners.comment: Getaway filly for whom market likely best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Getaway filly is second foal of an unraced mare, out of useful bumper/2m hurdle winning half-sister to smart 2m-2m4f hurdler/chaser Bright New Dawn; market likely best guide on debut.

runners.name: Ballinaboola Gold
runners.comment: Jet Away filly is second foal of a hurdle winner; another for whom market best guide
runners.spotlight: Jet Away filly is second foal of a 2m hurdle winner; another for whom market best guide on debut and Jody Townend booking takes the eye.

runners.name: Biddy Early
runners.comment: Recent debut Clonmel second could have a fitness edge over several of these
runners.spotlight: Idaho 4yo is fourth foal of a French 1m4f winner, half-sister to winners Free Handshake (2m6f hurdle) and Gracious (French Flat and 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase); 40-1 on recent Clonmel debut, coming late to chase home a 15l winner (good); encouraging first run and could have a fitness edge over several of these.

runners.name: Boogie On Down
runners.comment: Kept on in midfield on recent Cork debut, entitled to come on for that
runners.spotlight: Shirocco filly is second foal of an unraced half-sister to winners Tarqueens Glory (2m hurdle) and Fashionistalady (point); kept on in midfield on recent Cork debut, entitled to come on for that.

runners.name: Courtmac Gesture
runners.comment: Half-sister to Coney Island shaped with promise on Clonmel debut; more likely
runners.spotlight: Closely related to 2m4f hurdle winner Christmas Jumper, half-sister to three winners inc Coney Island (high-class 2m-3m hurdle/chase); unraced dam closely related to smart 2m4f-3m hurdler/chaser Wichita Lineman; 50-1 shot on Clonmel debut in March, shaping with some promise when keeping on into a remote third (good); something to build on.

runners.name: Crystal Supreme
runners.owner: Shout It From The Roof Top Syndicate
runners.comment: Respected yard, worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: Crystal Ocean filly is second foal of a 2m3f/2m4f chase winner, half-sister to winners Heath Hunter (bumper/2m-2m3f hurdle) and Oscar Wilde (2m3f chase), family of high-class 2m5f-3m chaser Nick Dundee; respected yard with 17% strike rate in bumpers last five years; worth market check.

runners.name: Getaway Lola
runners.comment: Pulled up on sole point-to-point last month, has since joined Terence O'Brien
runners.spotlight: Getaway sister to point-to-point winner Sanda Rena; dam unraced half-sister to useful 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase winner Leanne; pulled up on sole point-to-point last month, has since joined Terence O'Brien.

runners.name: Imagine It
runners.comment: Never sighted on debut in Grade 3 mares' bumper at Punchestown festival; sights lowered
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred half-sister to several winners; dam unplaced, from a smart family; never sighted on ambitious debut in Grade 3 mares' bumper at Punchestown festival last month; sights lowered here.

runners.name: Isabella Johnson
runners.comment: Runner-up at Ballinrobe and Kilbeggan; should again be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Has appreciated better ground to finish runner-up on latest two bumpers with a fortnight in April, at Ballinrobe and when chasing home a ready winner at Kilbeggan; should again be thereabouts.

runners.name: Lady With The Hat
runners.comment: Cheaply bought daughter of Salutino for whom market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Daughter of Salutino cost just 1,200 euros as a foal; third foal; dam 2m hurdle winner; market best guide on debut.

runners.name: Lake Okeechobee
runners.comment: Half-sister to Chris's Dream; will probably want more of a stamina test
runners.spotlight: Ocovango half-sister to winners Chris's Dream (high-class 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase), Scorpiancer (useful GB/US 2m-3m hurdle), Northern Girl (2m5f hurdle) and Graces Order (bumper); dam unraced, out of useful 2m-2m4f hurdle winner; nicely-bred debutante worth a market check.

runners.name: Master Sydney
runners.comment: Just behind Samba Train at Cork 3 weeks ago; won't have to improve too much to play a role
runners.spotlight: Mastercraftsman filly took a nice step forward on second start, travelling well into race and only tiring late when 3.5l off runner-up Samba Train at Cork three weeks ago (good); won't have to improve too much to play a role here.

runners.name: Poetic Twist
runners.comment: Half-sister to bumper winner Starzand; newcomer of obvious appeal for top yard
runners.spotlight: Poet's Word half-sister to bumper winner Starzand; dam 1m6f winner (RPR 63), half-sister to winners Dancing Meadows (bumper/2m2f hurdle) and Speaker Connolly (useful 2m hurdle/2m5f chase); newcomer of obvious appeal from top yard.

runners.name: Samba Train
runners.comment: Had Master Sydney 3.5l behind at Cork 3 weeks ago; major contender
runners.spotlight: Blue Bresil half-sister to winners Lady Chuffnell (2m hurdle) and Femme Magnifique (bumper/2m3f hurdle); dam 2m4f hurdle winner; not discredited on debut in Limerick maiden hurdle and showed more under positive ride in Cork bumper three weeks ago when second to a Gordon Elliott-trained winner, 3.5l ahead of third-placed Master Sydney; should play a major role again.

runners.name: Tonic
runners.comment: Half-sister to winning hurdler Therapist; not one to rule out on debut
runners.spotlight: Ulysses half-sister to 1m2f Flat and 2m hurdle winner Therapist; dam 7f winner, is half-sister to useful 6f/7f winner Diagnostic; debutante not one to rule out.

5:10.race_name: July 8th Family Day Mares Beginners Chase
5:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Selective watering)

runners.name: Amanha
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Tonnencourt
runners.comment: Career-best performance on penultimate start, capable of playing a role
runners.spotlight: Career-best performance in a Navan handicap hurdle on penultimate start when comfortably beating a subsequent winner (2m, soft); failed to build on that last time at Fairyhouse; she is capable of playing a role if putting her best foot forward on first try over fences.

runners.name: Betty Dutton
runners.comment: Has some nice placings in handicaps, not easy to win with but not a forlorn hope
runners.spotlight: Lacked a gear last time in a Sligo handicap hurdle when finishing a 34l fourth of 12 (3m2f, good); sole win came in a Roscommon maiden hurdle three years ago but she has some nice recent placings in handicaps; she is not easy to win with but is not a forlorn hope.

quotes.race: Thomas A. Murray Bar Roscommon Mares' Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Betty Dutton might not do a lot more this year but I hope she will be a good mare in the spring - Edward O'Grady, trainer.

runners.name: Femme Magnifique
runners.owner: Sullivan Group Limited & Shane Hughes & Neill Hughes

prev_owners.owner: Sullivan Bloodstock Limited & Shane Hughes & Neill Hughes
Sullivan Bloodstock Limited & Shane Hughes & Neill Hughes

runners.comment: First run over fences under rules needs to spark a revival but can't be discounted
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on last two starts; has previously won a bumper and a maiden hurdle but form since then has been ropey; first run over fences under rules needs to spark a revival but can't be discounted given her trainer.

runners.name: Florance
runners.comment: Modest hurdles form; better effort when last fence faller on chase debut here last night
runners.spotlight: Starting to fade when falling at the final fence on her chase debut here last night in a round full of sketchy jumping; that was here first run since October and it will be a surprise if she turns out again and if she did would need to jump better.

runners.name: Gaoth Chuil
runners.comment: Best of these on hurdle rating, fine performance on chase debut, mimimum trip a doubt
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler (rated 136); gave a fine performance when second on chase debut last month at Kilbeggan (2m4f, yielding); stays 3m so this minimum trip poses questions but on her hurdles rating she is the best of these.

quotes.race: Pertemps Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Gaoth Chuil is a good, tough, little mare, who is owned and bred by Michael Ryan. He had the dam and Harzand is a good stallion. She's only five and whether she runs in the Final at Cheltenham is a question mark, but we have the option now if we want to go - Ted Walsh, trainer.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Members Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gaoth Chuil had a good run here last day and ran very well at Christmas. She's bred to get further. Her owner is keen to go to Aintree so we'll see - Ted Walsh, trainer

runners.name: Ma Belle Etoile
runners.owner: P Haughey & P M Haughey & John Ball
runners.comment: Won a novice hurdle impressively last time, improving mare will take some beating
runners.spotlight: Provided Rachael Blackmore with her final career winner last time at Cork when impressively winning a novice hurdle by 12l (2m1f, good); that was by far a career-best and if capable of repeating that on her first try over fences she will take some beating here.

5:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Selective watering)

runners.name: I A Connect
runners.comment: Has struggled since last win in 2023, new headgear goes on but others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: Former Gordon Elliott-trained gelding; has struggled since last winning at Tipperary in 2023 (2m1f, good); pulled up the last twice; new headgear goes on but others make more appeal.

quotes.race: equuip - A Leg Up For Thoroughbred People Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: I A Connect pecked a bit at the back of second-last but he stays and probably wants further than that. I sent him on early as all he does is stay and to be fair to him he stuck his head out and battled - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Ireland Best Odds Guaranteed Hurdle
quotes.quote: I A Connect picked up again when the other horse came to him. He will be better over 2m4f - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was running a big race at Punchestown in a hot handicap hurdle when he got rid of Adrian Heskin at the second-last. There could be a nice race in him this season off his mark in the low 130s. 18-10-22

runners.name: Pipers Boreen
runners.comment: Won over this course and distance on most recent start, capable of running well
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D on most recent start last month; beat Therellbguddaysyet on that occasion but was in receipt of 10lb; has shown a liking for soft ground so the likely conditions underfoot may disadvantage her but she is capable of running well at this track.

quotes.race: SBK Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pipers Boreen showed a good attitude and is great to jump. The jump at the last probably sealed it for her - Shane Nolan, trainer.

runners.name: Therellbguddaysyet
runners.comment: Beaten by Pipers Boreen on last start when giving weight away, running ok on recent starts
runners.spotlight: Beaten 13.25l by Pipers Boreen on most recent start in a beginners' chase at this track last month; was giving the winner 10lbs that day and now meets her off level weights; landed Thurles maiden hurdle back in November and has been running okay in the meantime.

quotes.race: Killinan Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I rode Therellbguddaysyet myself last week when I felt the ground was a bit solid and he wants further. He's a kind horse who was only broken when he was six and Jack de Bromhead actually rode him when he was a breaker. Jack used to come up to us during the summer and was a wonderful kid. He might be looking down on us today - Michael O'Connor, trainer.

runners.name: Portarlington
runners.comment: Won three on the bounce last year including chase win at this track, can play a lead role
runners.spotlight: Won three on the bounce last year; a chase win at this track was sandwiched between two hurdle wins at Fairyhouse; has been disappointing on two recent runs on the Flat despite being sent off favourite; runs off 11lb higher mark than his win here but could defy that now that he is fit.

quotes.race: John Thomas McNamara Series (Q.R.) Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Portarlington didn't really come down the hill on quick ground at Limerick but he was suited by today. We might go at Navan on Sunday, it's only 2m but it's a stiff track - Ian Donoghue, trainer.

runners.name: Priory Park
runners.comment: Last-time-out winner benefitted from increase in trip, may have found his mojo over fences
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over fences last time at Limerick after 14 attempts (3m1f, good); the step up in trip appeared to benefit him that day; raised 5lb for his win but he seems to have found his mojo over fences and may be capable of going in again.

quotes.race: Irish Daily Star Christmas Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mark said they went a very moderate gallop and I was very worried with the last hurdle being missed because jumping is his forte but you'd have to say Priory Park did it quite nicely. He'll go up a little bit in trip - Edward O'Grady, trainer.

quotes.race: ThurlesRaces.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Priory Park will go for something similar next and will make a nice chaser, perhaps later in the season. He's a nice horse - Edward O'Grady, trainer.

runners.name: Killinure Lass
runners.comment: Recent runs have been disappointing but a decent third last time was a positive step
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over hurdles; second of seven over this C&D in beginners' chase last summer; recent runs have been disappointing but a step back in the right direction with a third at Sligo last time (3m2f, good); could get involved.

quotes.race: Leugh Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Killinure Lass got awfully lonesome on the run-in but luckily the line came in time. She was unlucky to bump into Ishan at Punchestown when she ran a belter and wasn't winning out of turn - Brian McMahon, trainer.

runners.name: Pebble Bleu
runners.comment: Weakened on the run-in last time and retains the same mark, more needed
runners.spotlight: Sole win came over fences at Punchestown under this rider from a mark of 99 last October (2m7f, good to yielding); weakened on the run-in last time at Wexford (3m1f, good) and retains same mark; more needed.

runners.name: The Little Yank
runners.comment: Good second last time broke streak of poor form, can get involved if builds on that
runners.spotlight: Broke a long streak of poor form with a good second at Cork on most recent start in January (2m4f, yielding to soft); is a three-time hurdle winner; his most recent win came three years ago in his sole win over fences (1-28); could get involved if last run was not a false dawn.

quotes.race: BetVictor Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Little Yank had a lot of trouble with ulcers and we couldn't figure what was wrong with him. He's going to be a smashing chaser for the summer - John Ryan, trainer.

runners.name: U Asking Me
runners.comment: Finished third last time on chase debut returning from a break, may have more to give now
runners.spotlight: Returned from an absence to finish a tired third of seven on chase debut at Limerick nine days ago (2m4f, good); he has some decent hurdles form including winning a handicap from a mark of 80 last October; from the point-to-point scene so may have more in his locker with fitness on his side.

runners.name: Game And Glory
runners.comment: 13lb lower chase mark, she has a nice weight but is not easy to win with
runners.spotlight: Two-time hurdle winner is yet to win over fences; recent form has been disappointing including being pulled up over C&D on penultimate start; 13lb lower chase mark; has a nice weight but not easy to win with.

Shane has done a lot of work with her at home because she's not an easy ride, so fair play to him - Shark Hanlon, trainer.
