runners.name: Liadawn
runners.comment: Nice pedigree; leading stable with exceptional strike-rate at the track; big player
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-sister to 1m7f Flat (RPR 67)/bumper and 2m-2m3f hurdle winner Williamstowndancer; dam bumper winner/placed 2m4f hurdle, sister to hurdle winners Touch Back (useful 2m2f-3m) and Sometime Soon (2m); leading stable with exceptional strike-rate at the track; big player.

runners.name: Tricksofthetrade
runners.comment: Placed on all three point starts and another solid effort when third in Cork bumper
runners.spotlight: Placed on all three point-to-point starts and another solid effort when third in Cork bumper on rules debut; the hood worn then is left off and she can get involved with improvement to come.

runners.name: Wild Mandate
runners.comment: Some useful bumper form, notably when collared late at Sligo last summer; respected
runners.spotlight: Some useful bumper form, notably when collared late at Sligo last summer (18.5f, good); well-backed at that track last time when respectable fourth of 11 over hurdles; respected.

runners.name: Cinnabar Moth
runners.comment: Well-backed on debut when a few lengths behind Tricksofthetrade at Cork in March; hooded
runners.spotlight: Well-backed on debut when a few lengths behind Tricksofthetrade at Cork in March; never a factor there three weeks ago; can race freely; hooded.

runners.name: Likealightswitch
runners.comment: Soldier Of Fortune filly; 8,000euros vendor foal; stable 1-24 in bumpers; best watched
runners.spotlight: Soldier Of Fortune filly; 8,000euros vendor foal; dam unraced half-sister to useful 2m3f-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Dorking Lad; stable 1-24 in bumpers; best watched.

runners.name: Kalibre
runners.breeder: Mme S Cozenot & Haras De Saint-Voir
runners.owner: Herve Cozenot, S Dehez Et Al

runners.name: Heraliste
runners.breeder: J-M Callier, Mlle N Callier & J Heupel
runners.owner: Gerard Joulie, Arnaud Chaille-Chaille & Jean-Marie Callier

runners.name: Fiction Du Berlais
runners.owner: Martin De Fraguier, Eric Aubree Et Al

runners.name: Transatlantic
runners.owner: Samuel Sutton, David Maughan & James Finch

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was important to get Transatlantic's head in front today. He enjoyed it out in front and handled the ground, although he would go on softer as he has a big old knee action on him - Niall Houlihan, jockey.

prev_owners.owner: A Gabryszewski, Mme B Re-Scandella & D Souchon

runners.name: Lucky One
runners.breeder: E A R L Du Bois Hue

quotes.race: Visit attheraces.com Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lucky One is a lovely horse. He travelled really well and jumped great. He was very keen over two and a half miles last time and the drop back to two miles has suited him well. He'll be a nice chaser one day and is one of the horses that has come from Willie Mullins that is quite exciting. I could see him going the right way with experience - Harry Cobden, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He could be all right and just needs to settle. There's plenty to come from him and he may go back in distance. 16-11-20

runners.name: Jaborosa
runners.owner: Jose Louis Da Silva, M Seror Et Al

runners.name: Hushua Des Obeaux
runners.breeder: Mme N Devilder & Les Obeaux D'Anjou

2:50.going_detailed: TURF: SOFT (Good to soft in places)

5:30.race_name: Shing Mun River Channel Handicap (Class 5) (3yo+) (Course B) (Turf)

runners.name: Circuit Mighty
runners.comment: On a long losing run but was placed in higher-grade company last month
runners.spotlight: It's now over two years since his latest win, but he was placed from stall 14 in a Class 4 C&D contest last month and Zac Purton is enlisted for this first start in Class 5; likely contender.

runners.name: Lucky Man
runners.comment: Went very close over C&D two starts ago and had excuses last time
runners.spotlight: A maiden after ten runs but went very close over C&D two starts ago and ended up poorly positioned on he wide outside when below that form this month; should have no such problem from stall 1 today and Hugh Bowman is a good booking; high on the list.

runners.name: Gluck Racer
runners.comment: Has mixed record this season; still 3lb higher than for narrow win in January
runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly over 1m1f here last month but has very mixed record this season and remains 3lb higher than when winning narrowly over C&D in January; drawn wide; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Circuit Fiery
runners.breeder: Haunui Bloodstock Ltd & B J O'Brien
runners.owner: Jason Cheung Cho Yee & Cheung Ka Shing
runners.comment: Safely held all three runs for new stable but will appreciate this ease in grade
runners.spotlight: Safely held on all three starts for new stable this season (6f-1m) and now 0-11 overall but is sure to appreciate this ease in grade; considered each-way.

runners.name: Pochettino
runners.comment: Placed in higher-grade C&D race in February but disappointing since
runners.spotlight: Placed in higher-grade C&D contest in February but subsequent form has been disappointing; drops in class but still needs to up his game.

runners.name: Foremost Teddy
runners.owner: Tse Ming Yee & Emily Tse Wing Man
runners.comment: Soundly beaten over C&D a fortnight ago and now 0-17
runners.spotlight: Ran quite well from the front when dropped to this grade last month, finishing fourth over 1m, but was soundly beaten over C&D a fortnight ago and is now 0-17.

runners.name: Brave Of Friends
runners.comment: Unplaced all nine starts and difficult to enthuse over
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all nine starts; campaigned mainly as a sprinter and finished well down the field when upped to 1m this month; runs over 7f for first time today.

runners.name: Flying Romantic
runners.comment: Placed twice over 6f since blinkers were added; well worth another go at 7f
runners.spotlight: 0-12 overall but has been placed on two of his three 6f starts since blinkers were added this year; looks well worth another crack at 7f; shortlisted.

runners.name: Lucky Generations
runners.comment: 0-11 but recent 6f runs were respectable and he's unexposed over 7f
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed after 11 starts but his last two 6f runs (turf/dirt) were respectable and he could plausibly have untapped potential over 7f; not ruled out.

runners.name: Ho Ho Star
runners.owner: Simon Tam Ngak Chou, Tam Hin Chi & Ray Tam Fai Chi
runners.comment: Has not kicked on from his 6f win in January and has the outside stall
runners.spotlight: Led close home to open account over 6f here in January, his 20th start; also suited by 7f but has not really kicked on from his success and has the outside draw today.

runners.name: Smart Beauty
runners.comment: Out of form this season and needs to turn a corner
runners.spotlight: Won four times over 1m here last year but has been out of form this season and needs to turn a corner.

runners.name: Tattenham

prev_owners.owner: T G Heptinstall, Ms N J Cruickshank Et Al

runners.comment: Placed over 1m on last month's stable/dirt debut; 7f may suit him better
runners.spotlight: Has modest Hong Kong strike-rate (1-27) but was placed on last month's stable/dirt debut (1m) and ran okay when back on turf a few days later; 7f may suit him better; enters calculations.

runners.name: Fung
runners.comment: Has struggled over 6f this year; has huge amount to prove on first 7f attempt
runners.spotlight: Belied 41-1 odds when fourth here (6f, dirt) in December but struggled on all three starts this year; has a huge amount to prove on first 7f attempt.

runners.name: Joyful Friendship
runners.owner: Violet Sin Lau Po Lan, C Sin Hong Ching & Chung Yen Ting

prev_owners.owner: The Executors Of The Estate Of The Late David Sin Wai Kin
M D Laurie, Miss K A Brideoake Et Al

runners.comment: Kept on for modest fourth over C&D this month but is now 0-21
runners.spotlight: Kept on for modest fourth over C&D in first-time visor a fortnight ago but is now 0-21; needs to find something extra to get a win on the board.

runners.name: Lucky Gold
runners.comment: Well below best this season, with recent efforts particularly disappointing
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner; well below best this season, though, and recent efforts have been particularly disappointing; drops in grade.

runners.name: Shinkansen
runners.comment: Recent 6f runs were respectable and he benefits from a drop in grade
runners.spotlight: Has modest 1-24 strike-rate and is yet to convince stamina-wise over 7f, but recent 6f runs were respectable and he benefits from a drop in grade.

runners.name: Helene Feeling
runners.comment: Six good efforts since January Group 3 win; top apprentice booked; all form on turf.
runners.spotlight: 1m1f Group 3 winner off a 7lb lower mark in January; has run consistently well in defeat in six subsequent starts (never beaten by over 2.5l); tasting dirt for the first time with top apprentice booked.

quotes.race: Cambion Electronics Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought Indian Dream was a nice horse at the start of the year but his tackle ruined his head and he's coming on now since he's been gelded. He made hard work of it but kept staying on and should go on from this - Ian Smith, travelling head lad.

runners.name: Californiatotality
runners.comment: Seven-time winner; has gone up 49lb since first victory; sixth on only previous dirt run.
runners.spotlight: Winner of half of his last 14 races, including the last two, now switching to dirt (sixth on only previous try); only edged home by a neck last time and is now 7lb higher.

runners.name: Capital Delight
runners.comment: Likes dirt though all his wins over 6f; lesser effort last time; now tries a visor.
runners.spotlight: Four-time 6f dirt winner here; has some form over this far and switch to visor from blinkers could bring further progress, though he remains 6lb above highest successful mark.

runners.name: Mr Ascendency

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Reverts to best surface after three modest turf efforts so could be revived.
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in ten of his last 12 starts but goes well on this surface and is back down to just 1lb above his highest winning mark (over this C&D 14 months go).

quotes.race: bet365 Esher Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Rifleman has never put a foot wrong in his life and decided to do it there. I don't know whether he saw something. The horse just ducked and Ryan said he suddenly had no horse. That was strange - I don't bring horses to the races to do that. It was as much as a surprise to us as it was to you - John Gosden, trainer.

runners.name: Telecom Fighters
runners.comment: Recent short head C&D winner (5lb higher here); front-runner; may not be able to dominate.
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who pulled off a 57-1 surprise over this C&D off 5lb lower mark in March; likely to face competition for the lead which tempers enthusiasm for his chance.

runners.name: Soleil Fighter
runners.comment: In top form of late; untried on dirt; weighted to take revenge on Californiatotality.
runners.spotlight: Wonderfully consistent (three wins and six places from his last ten runs); now 6lb better off for the neck Californiatotality beat him 17 days ago; trying dirt for the first time.

quotes.race: racingtv.com/freetrial Handicap
quotes.quote: Ideally a really hard mile is what Connemara Coast wants, when he's almost off the bridle behind, and then he'll outstay them, but he'll definitely be a mile and quarter horse next season. He might go to the July meeting but Ryan thought there'd be an Ascot handicap for him at the end of the year. When they go flat out at Ascot it will be perfect for him - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has never run a bad race in his six starts to date, which includes a win at Wolverhampton last autumn and at Sandown on his most recent outing. Ryan [Moore] won on him at the Esher track and it is always great to get him, but he is a man in serious demand and it is not that easy to get him on one of yours. He is now on a 3lb higher mark of 86 and the plan is to head back to either Newmarket for the July meeting next month where there is a three-year-old 0-95 mile handicap, or Ascot a day later for a 0-95 for three-year-olds. We will try to get Ryan again as he remains on a very workable mark. 29-06-23

runners.name: Noisy Boy

prev_owners.owner: D M Richards, R M Richards & Ms E L Mitchell

runners.comment: Two wins and a close second from his last three handicaps; untried on dirt; needs further.
runners.spotlight: Dual winner (1m2f & 1m3f) then struggled in two tries in open company; back to form when caught on the line last time (1m4f); has never run in dirt; this trip wil surely prove too sharp.

runners.name: Self Improvement
runners.owner: Wong Chung Yin & Wong Lai Ngor
runners.comment: Likes dirt but all his form on it is over 6f; hard to imagine that he can last this far.
runners.spotlight: Four-time dirt winner but always over 6f and, following two lesser runs after a March victory, this experiment over 1m55y with blinkers removed is likely to prove unsuccessful.

runners.name: Sing Dragon
runners.owner: The Rotary Club Of Gd-Hk-Ma-Gba Syndicate
runners.comment: Goes well on dirt and was second on it last time but step up from 6f unikely to suit.
runners.spotlight: Four-time 6f dirt winner here and proved that he is still at the top of his game when finishing runner-up last time but today's trip is a huge question mark.

runners.name: Must Go
runners.comment: In cracking form but this big step up from 6f is likely to prove beyond him.
runners.spotlight: Winner of three of his last four (all 6f, dirt); raised another 6lb to another career-high mark following latest short head success; unplaced on two previous runs over 1m55y.

runners.name: Talents Ambition
runners.comment: This is his favourite C&D and should go well again following close third three weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Two wins and three places from his last six attempts over this C&D, including 0.75l third off 1lb lower three weeks ago, so must be on the shortlist.

runners.name: Yellowfin
runners.owner: Raymond Ng Wing Chiu, Choi Chi Wan & Soong Tze Man
runners.comment: Without a success in 13 months yet is still 2lb above his highest winning mark.
runners.spotlight: Has a C&D triumph to his name, but that was off 9lb lower mark in 2023 and has been placed just once from nine runs this season.

runners.name: Turin Mascot
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock
runners.owner: Dr Sheldon Tse Hiu Tung, Ken Huang Jian Hua & Tsoi Huk Yam

prev_owners.owner: Tsoi Huk Yam, Sheldon Tse Hiu Tung & Ken Huang Jian Hua

runners.comment: Unplaced in his last seven starts and is 4lb wrong in the weights here.
runners.spotlight: Out of form since winning over C&D off 3lb lower in October and makes little appeal from 4lb out of the handicap.

quotes.race: Lengthen The Odds With BetVictor Race
quotes.quote: In Ecstasy is a progressive horse who enjoys the all-weather. We will have a look at heading back there in February for the Listed three-year-old race - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Winning Gold
runners.comment: Career-best performance over C&D a fortnight ago, keeping on strongly to win readily
runners.spotlight: Posted career-best performance over C&D a fortnight ago, keeping on strongly to win readily; 6lb rise demands more today but he's evidently in very good nick.

runners.name: Tourbillon Prince

prev_owners.owner: Ms S M Moloney & M A Epis

runners.comment: Has mixed record since pair of 7f wins in December but back down to a good mark now
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f course winner in December; has very mixed record in the meantime but ran fairly well over C&D a fortnight ago and has dropped back down to a good mark.

runners.name: Never Peter Out
runners.comment: Four dirt wins this season; well held last time, though, and looks opposable back on turf
runners.spotlight: Very progressive on dirt this season, winning four times over 1m; disappointed when last in action, though, and needs to transfer all of his improvement back to turf today.

runners.name: Gentlemen Legacy

prev_owners.owner: Mrs K L Cumming, P Cumming Et Al

runners.comment: Made just a mildly encouraging Hong Kong debut but might come on for the run
runners.spotlight: 3-10 when based in Australia; made only a mildly encouraging Hong Kong debut here (7f) three weeks ago but might come on for the run.

runners.name: Ariel
runners.comment: Dual dirt winner this year but has gone off the boil lately and remains on a tough mark
runners.spotlight: Dual dirt winner this year (1m1f/1m) but has gone off the boil lately and remains on a tough mark.

runners.name: Young Brilliant
runners.comment: Surprise winner on dirt in December but not in same form again since
runners.spotlight: Caused 44-1 surprise on dirt here (1m) in December but has not been in the same form again since and finished last when back on turf here (1m1f) last month.

quotes.race: Cazoo Handicap
quotes.quote: Swilcan Bridge handled the course well. He had a run here earlier in the year and had run very well at Goodwood last time out. He crept into the Royal Hunt Cup, actually, today, but when you've got the opportunity to run for this sort of prize-money, if he's going to take a 10lb hike it doesn't matter. You're just thrilled to have a winner on Derby Day - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.name: Magnificent Nine
runners.comment: In the frame all four starts since 7f course win in February; likely contender again
runners.spotlight: Admirably consistent 5yo who deserved his 7f course win in February and has made the frame on all four starts since, the last twice over C&D; likely to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Fighting Machine
runners.breeder: Miss J M, K J & Mrs M L Shaw
runners.comment: Placed several times on dirt since 7f turf win in September; each-way claims again
runners.spotlight: Placed five times over 1m on dirt in this grade since 7f Class 4 turf win in September; just a respectable sixth on that surface three weeks ago but switches back to turf on a workable mark; considered each-way.

runners.name: Flying Luck
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Horatio Ho Yiu Wing, Ho Garrick Sai Man & H L S Kit
runners.comment: Dual course winner this season (7f/1m); very close third on latest outing (1m1f); player
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive 4yo who doubled his tally with ready C&D win in March and was beaten only narrowly when third over 1m1f here last month; swaps hood and blinkers for first-time visor today; may still have a bigger run in him.

runners.name: Legendary Years
runners.breeder: K D Landrigan & P J Landrigan
runners.comment: Listed winner in NZ last year but a well-beaten outsider on both HK starts
runners.spotlight: Delivered on debut promise when winning 1m Listed race in New Zealand last May but was a well-beaten outsider on first two Hong Kong starts (7f/1m).

runners.name: Prestige Ricky

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Looked promising in Britain but has cut little ice in Hong Kong (three runs)
runners.spotlight: Looked promising when trained in Britain but has cut little ice in Hong Kong (three runs) and probably needs further help from the local handicapper.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai British EBF "Confined" Maiden Stakes (C & G) (No More Than 2 Runs) (Div I)
quotes.quote: It was a messy race but Accumulate got the job done which is the main thing. He could run again this year but we'll have to see how he comes out of this - Roger Varian, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He could start off at Ascot on May 10 in a Class 2 handicap over seven furlongs and we'll see if he develops into a horse for the Britannia. He's that kind of horse and hasn't done much wrong so far. 25-04-24

runners.name: Illuminous
runners.owner: Christina Y C Ting, Chen Wen Bin Et Al
runners.comment: Out of form when last in action; needs to have been refreshed by 111-day break
runners.spotlight: Began this season with three good efforts (1m-1m1f) but finished well down the field on next three outings (7f-1m1f); needs to have been refreshed by 111-day break.

runners.name: Charity Together
runners.comment: Progressive handicapper in Britain last year but has made low-key start to HK career
runners.spotlight: Progressive handicapper in Britain last year, signing off with three consecutive wins (7f/1m) in August/September, but was unable to land a telling blow on his two recent Hong Kong starts (both 1m).

quotes.race: Welcome To Family Day Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: When Corriamo is three and he's had a winter over him, he'll be a very strong horse, and I'd expect to see him in some better races. We hope it's onwards and upwards with him. He didn't handle coming down the hill for whatever reason, he was a bit slowly away and he couldn't quite go that early pace. He was a bit green, but we're very pleased - Marcus Tregoning, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Oriental Smoke
runners.comment: Course winner this month but this exposed 7yo looks vulnerable in this higher grade
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner, most recently when leading close home over 1m1f here a fortnight ago; can give another good account today but this exposed 7yo looks a shade vulnerable in this higher grade.

6:00.race_name: Sha Tin Hoi Handicap (Div I) (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course B) (Turf)

runners.name: Courier Aladdin
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Chadwick Mok Cham Hung
runners.comment: C&D winner on debut last July; off since lesser run in October; still of interest
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D on debut in July; reappeared with disappointing effort in October and absent again since but could still have significant potential and Zac Purton keeps the faith.

runners.name: Amazing Victory
runners.comment: Out of form over 7f/1m for new stable in recent months
runners.spotlight: Out of form over 7f/1m for new stable in recent months and remains without a win since 2022; well drawn for this return to sprinting but still makes only limited appeal.

runners.name: Lucky Archangel
runners.comment: Placed twice last month and remains well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Multiple 6f winner in Hong Kong; yet to hit the target this season but was placed twice last month and remains well handicapped.

runners.name: Emblazon
runners.comment: Out of a 6f Group 3 winner but probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Out of an Australian 6f Group 3 winner and has shown ability in recent trials but is probably best watched on this official debut.

runners.name: Flowing Riches
runners.comment: Drawn wide for official debut but has won two trials in recent weeks
runners.spotlight: Out of a 1m winner; has won sprint trials on turf and dirt in recent weeks; not drawn well for official debut but still looks interesting.

runners.name: Straight To Glory
runners.owner: Chan Tim Shing & Pang Wai Hak
runners.comment: Made very promising debut over 5f this month; well drawn for first 6f attempt
runners.spotlight: Shaped with significant promise when fourth over 5f here on recent debut and has good draw for this first 6f attempt; high on the list.

runners.name: Super Universal
runners.breeder: C P & Miss P L Howells
runners.owner: Johnny Ng Kit Chong & Nancy Wong
runners.comment: Makes official debut after some underwhelming trials and is not drawn well
runners.spotlight: Out of a three-time winner (5f-7f); makes official debut after some underwhelming trials and is not drawn well.

runners.name: Matters Most
runners.comment: Useful sprint handicapper in Britain but yet to be placed after ten HK starts
runners.spotlight: Useful sprint handicapper when based in Britain but yet to be placed after ten Hong Kong starts and recent efforts don't offer much hope.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We hadn't got Matters Most on the grass before his first run and he was green and got squeezed, but today he was very professional. He wants a sixth furlong and I don't know where we'll go, but there might be a race at Pontefract coming up, which could suit him. He's very straightforward and we like him. He's out of a Pastoral Pursuits mare so he's bred to handle this ground, but he moves like he'd handle quicker ground and I've have no qualms about trying him on a faster surface - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

runners.name: Turf Phoenix
runners.owner: Dr John Shum Ding Ping & Dr Lawrence Chan Pui Wing
runners.comment: Has struggled to get competitive during this first Hong Kong season
runners.spotlight: Has struggled to get competitive during this first Hong Kong season and can't be recommended.

runners.name: Glaciated
runners.owner: Alan Chiu Chun Ming, Sandy Cheng Chuk Wah & W Law Chi Yin
runners.comment: Unexposed 3yo; has shown clear promise but needs to improve
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who has shown clear promise on all three appearances (5f/6f); needs improvement to pose a significant threat though.

runners.name: Ka Ying Resilience
runners.comment: Ran quite well on recent dirt debut but is now 0-8
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; ran fairly well when sixth on recent dirt debut but others in this line-up have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Riding High

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Placed over C&D in January but this 11-race maiden has a tough draw
runners.spotlight: Now 8lb lower than when placed over C&D in January and didn't run badly when dropped back to 5f this month, but this 11-race maiden has a tough draw.

runners.name: Euro Rocks
runners.comment: In fair form over 7f in December/January but has tough draw for reappearance
runners.spotlight: Posted a couple of fairly good 7f runs in December/January but remains a maiden after 15 Hong Kong starts and has tough draw on this first outing for four months.

runners.name: Sight Dreamer
runners.comment: Ran quite well over 7f recently but has wide draw for this drop back in trip
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all six runs; kept on for fourth over 7f here a fortnight ago but this drop back to 6f may not be ideal and his wide draw certainly isn't.

runners.name: Patch Of Time
runners.comment: Below form last month but was placed twice here in March; a possible
runners.spotlight: Below form on latest outing but was placed twice here in March (turf/dirt) and was a dual C&D winner in the early part of this season; has a fighting chance if back on song.

runners.name: Drala
runners.owner: Frank Lyn Yee Chon & Ivy Lai
runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after six runs
runners.spotlight: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after six runs and almost certainly needs a drop in grade.

6:30.race_name: Sha Tin Hoi Handicap (Div II) (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course B) (Turf)

runners.name: Lucky Symphony
runners.comment: Ready C&D winner from stall 14 this month; may still have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Took form to new level when winning readily over C&D from stall 14 this month, his eighth start; 8lb higher and drawn wide again today but not opposed lightly after that recent performance.

runners.name: Better And Better
runners.comment: Only eighth when favourite for recent debut; Zac Purton jumps ship
runners.spotlight: Favourite for recent C&D debut but ended up on the outside of the field and managed only eighth; ought to be capable of better but Zac Purton has jumped ship.

runners.name: Diriya
runners.comment: Fourth over C&D on last month's debut, having been denied a clear run
runners.spotlight: Kept on for fourth over C&D on last month's debut, having been denied a clear run; Zac Purton evidently prefers Ka Ying Warrior today but this fellow has the inside stall again and features prominently in calculations.

runners.name: Happy Park
runners.comment: C&D winner in December but recent efforts have been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Now only 1lb higher then when scoring over C&D in December but his recent efforts have been underwhelming; others in the line-up have much less to prove.

runners.name: Incredible Moment
runners.comment: Unexposed 3yo who launched his career with two promising runs at Happy Valley
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who launched his career with two promising runs at Happy Valley, latterly when making a lot of the running from stall 12; no surprise if he gives this a good shot.

runners.name: Lucky My Way
runners.breeder: C T Grammer, D W Mayers & P D Stopforth (Nz)
runners.owner: Patrick Wong Ho Yin, Ricky Choy Wing Kay Et Al
runners.comment: Bettered poor debut when staying-on third over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Left inauspicious debut a long way behind when staying-on third over C&D last month; encountered some traffic that day and has plenty of scope for further improvement.

runners.name: Prestige Hall
runners.comment: Won a recent 6f dirt trial but makes official debut in a competitive race
runners.spotlight: Out of a 6f winner; won a recent 6f dirt trial and evidently has ability but makes his debut in a competitive race for the grade.

runners.name: Smart Fat Cat
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Admund Au Chi Hoe
runners.comment: Came second in a trial last month but has a tough draw for this official debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a 1m winner; came second in a 6f trial last month but has a tough draw for this official debut; best watched.

runners.name: Ka Ying Warrior
runners.comment: C&D winner in February; Zac Purton probably had other riding options here
runners.spotlight: Held on well to open account over C&D in February and returned from break with very respectable fifth here this month; needs to kick on again to overcome current mark but Zac Purton probably had other riding options in this race.

runners.name: Club Ace
runners.comment: Placed on three of his eight starts; below form last time; drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Placed on three of his eight starts, most recently when third over C&D this month; now 2lb below that mark but his latest run was disappointing and he's draw wide.

runners.name: Ace Power
runners.owner: Chan Ngan Chi & Chen Yung Hung
runners.comment: Twice safely held since last-gasp win at Happy Valley in March
runners.spotlight: Finished well for last-gasp win at Happy Valley in March but safely held off new mark twice since and has a wide draw.

runners.name: Amazing Galaxy
runners.comment: Unplaced all five starts but posted a couple of good efforts over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed after five starts but posted a couple of good efforts over C&D last month and is well drawn; not ruled out each-way.

runners.name: Magic Combo
runners.breeder: D T Champion, Llanhennock Trust & M
runners.owner: Tong Kin Hing, Dr Francis Siu Pui Sing & Siu Miu Man
runners.comment: Unable to land a significant blow on any of first four starts
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a significant blow on any of first four starts (6f-7f) and seemingly on a beeline for Class 5.

runners.name: View All Things
runners.comment: Last two runs were very disappointing and he's now 0-6
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden; has shown some promise over 7f this year but his last two runs (7f/6f) were very disappointing.

runners.name: Golden Brilliant
runners.breeder: Mrs C A & C C Chamberlain
runners.comment: Has not shown enough in trials to warrant consideration on debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a 5.7f winner; has not shown enough in trials to warrant consideration on this official debut.

runners.name: Star Satyr
runners.comment: Ran okay at Happy Valley this month but needs further improvement
runners.spotlight: Ran on for respectable sixth at Happy Valley this month, his third start, but needs further improvement.

runners.name: New Forest
runners.comment: In the frame over C&D on both dirt starts; eased in grade after fair turf run
runners.spotlight: Made the frame over C&D on first two dirt starts (both this year) and now drops in grade after perfectly respectable 7f turf run this month; has awkward draw today but still needs to be taken very seriously.

runners.name: Charming Steed
runners.comment: 3-9 on dirt after recent C&D win; latest 6lb rise might leave him vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well to score over C&D under Ellis Wong three weeks ago and is now 3-9 on this surface; recent 6lb rise might be enough to leave him vulnerable today, though.

runners.name: Magniac

prev_owners.owner: Mrs J Andrews, R F Drage Et Al

runners.comment: 6f dirt winner last season but generally very disappointing this term; new trip
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f on dirt last season and hinted at possible return to form when fifth over that trip this month but has largely been very disappointing this term and has stamina to prove today.

runners.name: Fashion Legend
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Boniface Ho Ka Kui
runners.comment: Best known as a turf sprinter but has taken very well to this C&D lately
runners.spotlight: Best known as a turf sprinter but won readily over C&D when upped to 1m for dirt debut in March; two very respectable C&D runs have followed; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Precision Goal
runners.comment: Late-maturing 6yo who has collected three C&D wins this season; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing 6yo who has collected three C&D wins this season; stayed on for third behind Charming Steed here three weeks ago and is 1lb lower today; shortlisted.

runners.name: Celestial Harmony

prev_owners.owner: Lindsay Park Bloodstock & H M P Lam

runners.comment: Unplaced all eight HK starts, including one down-the-field dirt run
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who is yet to be placed after eight Hong Kong starts; finished well down the field on dirt in December; difficult to enthuse over.

runners.name: Forever Folks
runners.comment: In the frame over C&D on last two outings; each-way claims at least
runners.spotlight: Often finds the winning line coming too soon but kept on well to make the frame over C&D on his last two outings and is now only 1lb higher than when winning over C&D in October; each-way claims at least.

runners.name: Regency Win Win
runners.comment: Made quite promising debut but two very disappointing runs have followed
runners.spotlight: Made quite promising debut over 6f on dirt in March but two very disappointing 7f turf runs have followed; might be happier back on this surface but it still takes a leap of faith to support him.

runners.name: Meepmeep
runners.comment: Class 5 C&D winner last month and close second in this grade since
runners.spotlight: Came good with narrow Class 5 C&D win last month, his 13th start, and was commendable second to Charming Steed from stall 14 when back up in this grade three weeks ago; drawn wide again today but still respected in current form.

runners.name: Deal Completed
runners.comment: Began season with 7f turf win but badly out of form since
runners.spotlight: Began this season with a 7f turf win but has been badly out of sorts since and is not yet proven on dirt.

runners.name: Spangle Fortune
runners.comment: Yet to win in this grade but recent C&D efforts give him a fighting chance
runners.spotlight: Gained both Hong Kong wins in Class 5, the latter over C&D in November, but has posted two good efforts over C&D in this higher grade in recent weeks; could have a say.

runners.name: Viva Chaleur

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Suited by this C&D and on a good mark but Hong Kong strike-rate is 0-28
runners.spotlight: Well suited by this C&D and has slipped to a tempting mark but was below form behind Charming Steed here three weeks ago and is now 0-28 in Hong Kong.

runners.name: All Are Mine
runners.comment: Out of form this season and eligible for a drop in grade now
runners.spotlight: Won over 1m1f on this surface last season but has been out of form this term and is eligible for a drop in grade now.

runners.name: Lucky Impact
runners.comment: Has claims if judged on last month's C&D fourth but others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for close fourth over C&D two starts ago and has possibilities if judged on that performance but he fluffed the start here three weeks ago and is now 0-9; others preferred.

runners.name: Hinokami Kagura
runners.comment: Second twice over 6f on dirt lately; back up in grade for first 1m attempt
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden; runner-up over 6f on dirt on last two appearances but moves back up in grade for this first 1m attempt.

runners.name: Great Spirit
runners.comment: Dual 6f turf winner this season; tries new trip-and-surface combination today
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f turf winner this season but was below form when last in action and it's not easy to predict whether this new trip-and-surface combination will suit.

runners.name: Dazzling Fit
runners.breeder: Ms R Bennett & D A Dollimore
runners.comment: Off the mark three weeks ago; 7lb higher now but still unexposed; contender
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over C&D three weeks ago with a strong display; 7lb higher now but still unexposed and open to improvement; one of the leading contenders.

runners.name: Basic Instinct
runners.owner: 22/23 Me Tsui Yu Sak Trainer Syndicate
runners.comment: Well held in all four local starts; needs marked improvement to get seriously involved
runners.spotlight: Well held in all four local appearances; needs marked improvement to get seriously involved.

runners.name: Solid Win
runners.comment: C&D winner on New Year's Day but hasn't built on that success; others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: C&D winner on New Year's Day but hasn't built on that success in four subsequent runs off higher marks; others arrive with more pressing claims.

runners.name: Mr Cool
runners.comment: Made all to score over C&D on his second start; fair effort off a 6lb higher mark since
runners.spotlight: Made all to score over C&D on his second start; fair effort off a 6lb higher mark since and remains open to progress; not discounted.

runners.name: Gallant Epoch
runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Simon Suen Siu Man & Chloe Suen
runners.comment: Front-running win over C&D in February; not the most consistent since but retains ability
runners.spotlight: Impressive front-running win over C&D in February; hasn't been the most consistent since but retains ability; dangerous if things fall his way.

runners.name: Excel Wongchoy
runners.comment: Dirt winner over the extended mile in November but has struggled since; more needed
runners.spotlight: Dirt winner over the extended mile in November but has struggled since; needs to find more to get involved.

runners.name: Fun Together
runners.breeder: M W Gething, I N & Mrs S K Gillatt
runners.comment: Completed a C&D hat-trick last season; form has dipped this term but mark has eased
runners.spotlight: Completed a C&D hat-trick last season; form has dipped this term but mark has eased accordingly; revival not ruled out.

runners.name: Gor Gor
runners.comment: Finished ninth on debut three weeks ago in line with market expectations; best watched
runners.spotlight: Finished ninth on debut three weeks ago in line with market expectations; experience should bring him on but likely best watched for now.

runners.name: Golden Luck
runners.owner: Chan Kam Shing, Wu Kai Char Et Al
runners.comment: Won on return in September but hasn't built on that since; mark is falling
runners.spotlight: Won on return in September but hasn't built on that since; mark is falling again and he's handicapped to figure if bouncing back.

runners.name: Von Baer
runners.comment: Little impact in nine local starts and remains hard to fancy on current evidence
runners.spotlight: Little impact in nine local starts and remains hard to fancy on current evidence.

quotes.race: tote Are Online Too At tote.co.uk Racing League 16 Handicap (Trainers Reg' To Racing League)
quotes.quote: Von Baer just wandered around quite a lot. I was left in front a long way from home. I didn't really want to be as forward as I ended up being through the race and he was lonely from the three [furlong] pole onwards. I was just trying to keep his mind focussed in the right direction but he was always pulling out enough and he's obviously a pretty smart horse. I think he won despite the track - he did feel a bit unbalanced in the first half of the race - but the cut in the ground probably helped and he's still very lightly raced so there's plenty left to come - Saffie Osborne, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: King Lotus
runners.comment: Took a big step forward from debut when landing a 6f win two weeks ago; 6lb higher today
runners.spotlight: Took a big step forward from debut when landing a 6f win two weeks ago; will have to prove that was no fluke with a 6lb rise to overcome.

runners.name: Handsome Bomb
runners.breeder: Haunui Bloodstock Ltd & B J O'Brien
runners.comment: Signed off last season with a win but has failed to recapture that form this term
runners.spotlight: Signed off last season with a win but has failed to recapture that form this term; more needed despite sliding mark.

runners.name: Mr Justice
runners.comment: Outclassed in all three career starts so far; future looks to lie in Class 5
runners.spotlight: Outclassed in all three career starts so far; hard to make a case and his future looks to lie in Class 5.

runners.name: Arden
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs James Tien Pei Chun
runners.comment: Slight improvement in recent outings; needs more to play a serious role
runners.spotlight: Slight improvement in recent outings, including a fair C&D fifth; needs to build on that to play a serious role.

runners.name: Flying Double
runners.owner: Raymond Tsang Heung Tak & Kenneth Tsang Heung Kan
runners.comment: Showed promise in his first couple of starts but recent outings have been disappointing
runners.spotlight: Showed plenty of promise in his first couple of starts but recent outings have been disappointing; needs to get back on track.

runners.name: Red Lion
runners.owner: The Hon Ronald Arculli Gbm Gbs Jp & Johanna K J Arculli Bbs
runners.comment: Caused an upset at the top level last month; may be vulnerable back in handicap company
runners.spotlight: Returned to winning ways when causing an upset at the top level over C&D last month; previous handicap success was off a mark 16lb lower than his current rating.

quotes.race: FBD Hotels And Resorts Handicap
quotes.quote: Fiach McHugh won his maiden in Dundalk. He was second to Ivy League then when he ran too free over 1m and that's why we dropped back to 7f. We settled out the back today and I think he'll get a mile ridden like that. We might give him an entry in the Britannia Stakes at Ascot - Andy Slattery, trainer.

runners.name: Chancheng Glory
runners.comment: Group 3 winner in January; held off his elevated mark since so needs to find more
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner over C&D; career highlight came with a Group 3 handicap success here in January; held off his elevated mark since so will need to take another step forward.

runners.name: Beauty Eternal
runners.comment: Failed to run up to the form of his Group 1 success this term; needs to turn things around
runners.spotlight: Produced a career best when finishing ahead of Red Lion in a Group 1 event last season; has failed to run up to that form in seven outings this term; needs to turn things around.

quotes.race: FWD Champions Mile (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was the only hope we had to go forward from Beauty Eternal's draw as there was no speed in the race. They gave us the opportunity to lead and he got into a lovely rhythm and controlled the race. I thought this was the only way we could beat Golden Sixty. I've always felt there was a bit more there, and we saw his full potential - Zac Purton, jockey.

runners.name: Beauty Joy
runners.owner: Eleanor Kwok Law Kwai Chun & Patrick Kwok Ho Chuen
runners.comment: Success has slowed in recent times and he is in his veteran stage; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Triple winner over today's C&D but success has slowed in recent times and he is in his veteran stage to boot; seventh behind several of today's rivals in a Group 1 event last month.

runners.name: Happy Together
runners.comment: Performed with credit in pattern company this term; big career best still needed
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive last season and has performed with credit in pattern company this term; big career best needed to overcome his current mark.

runners.name: Sunlight Power
runners.comment: Third behind Red Lion in a Group 1 event last month; strong claims on these terms
runners.spotlight: Has continued his progression this season, scoring three times from ten starts; arguably posted his best effort yet when finishing third behind Red Lion in a Group 1 event last month; strong claims on these terms.

runners.name: Divano
runners.comment: 5-15; held off his revised mark last month so needs to find more on his first Group start
runners.spotlight: 5-15 with his latest success coming over 7f here last month; held off his revised mark on his latest start so will need to find something extra on his first appearance in Group company.

runners.name: Encountered
runners.comment: Generally disappointing in eight starts this season; has slipped to a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Losing run dates back to November 2023 and he has been generally disappointing in eight starts this season; subsequently has slipped to a workable mark but needs to turn things around.

stable_tour.quote: When the yearlings come in you can usually spot the nice ones straightaway and this fellow stood out in the pack. I like his sire and he has left his stamp on this colt who is physically gorgeous, sound, strong, a good mover and has an excellent temperament. This fellow made a very pleasing debut at Haydock in May and it did him the power of good. He came forward for that and I expected a big run last week at Doncaster, when he did not disappoint with a 4L win. Potentially he could be anything as our juveniles usually come on a lot for their initial efforts. The plan immediately after that was the Superlative Stakes this week but I spoke to his owner afterwards and he is a very patient man with his horses and suggested we may wait a little longer, in which case the Listed Pat Eddery Stakes at Ascot on 24 July would be the target. This son of Churchill has always looked a cut above my others and the lads that have ridden him at home have all said he feels like a proper horse. I think he has a very bright future and could be anything. I know it is early days but he could be very smart indeed. 07-07-21

runners.name: Johannes Brahms
runners.comment: Good third in the HK Classic Cup; likely has more to offer and certainly isn't ignored
runners.spotlight: 2-8 and was a good third in the Hong Kong Classic Cup in March; likely has more to offer and is not ignored on today's step up in class.

stable_tour.quote: He's in good shape and had a couple of nice runs last season and likes a nice bit of ground. We'll start him off in a Guineas trial and go from there. He could stretch out to a mile at most. We view him as a miler at the moment but he could be a sprinter. 03-04-24

runners.name: Ka Ying Generation
runners.comment: Distant second place finish in a Group 2 event has separated two heavy defeats this term
runners.spotlight: Made his local breakthrough over 1m2f here last season; a distant second place finish in a Group 2 event has separated two heavy defeats this term.

quotes.race: Book Online At DundalkStadium.com Maiden
quotes.quote: Teutates has a lovely turn of foot. He was green out of the gates so I was bit further back than ideal but it rode like a good race. He came into the straight lovely and I saw a gap and he sprinted away. It was a nice performance and he will definitely get further, he's only learning - Paddy Harnett, jockey.

runners.name: Pray For Mir
runners.owner: Chris So Chun Hung & Alexander So

prev_owners.owner: TFI & Kia Ora Stud W S

runners.comment: Hit the crossbar on several occasions since turn of the year; big step up in class today
runners.spotlight: Only one success in 14 local starts but has hit the crossbar on several occasions since the turn of the year; today's big leap in class requires plenty more however.

runners.name: Masterofmyuniverse
runners.comment: Highly progressive; 7lb rise for latest win may not anchor him given his upward trajectory
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive, scoring three times from eight starts; 7lb rise for latest win may not anchor him given his upward trajectory; strong claims once more.

runners.name: Savvy Brilliant
runners.comment: Shaped as though in need of the run last month; should strip fitter this time
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner early in his career; shaped as though in need of the run when safely held returning from a break last month; should strip fitter this time.

runners.name: Super Legends
runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner this season; remains well handicapped enough to be a player again
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner this season, latest success coming in this grade; consistent since and remains well handicapped enough to be a serious player again.

runners.name: Infinite Resolve

prev_owners.owner: P C Orton, Vinery Stud Et Al

runners.comment: Maiden winner in Australia; has shown some promising signs in recent trials
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner when trained by Ciaron Maher in Australia; has shown some promising signs in recent trials; consult market.

runners.name: Turin Starspangled
runners.owner: Tsoi Huk Yam, Ken Huang Jian Hua Et Al
runners.comment: Scored on seasonal return; form has dipped since and he was well beaten last time
runners.spotlight: Scored on seasonal return in September to make local breakthrough; form has dipped since and was well beaten last time, needs to bounce back.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: He's always worked like a fair one. Devious shouldn't be that fast being that big and strong so I'd say he's a proper horse. I was thinking coming here today that we could look at the Coventry but showing the speed that he did we could look at the Norfolk maybe instead. We have nothing that can take him off the bridle at home, he's just natural. He's got so much boot that the nice ground helps him but he would get slower ground as well as he's big and powerful - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer

runners.name: Kempes
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Colin Lo Chor Cheong
runners.comment: Promising seasonal return when sixth in November but has failed to build on that run
runners.spotlight: Promising seasonal return when sixth in November but has failed to build on that run in two outings since; something to prove now.

runners.name: Righteous Arion
runners.comment: Third off revised mark last time suggests he remains on a competitive rating; considered
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner, most recently over C&D in February; close third off his revised mark last time suggests he remains on a competitive rating; one to consider.

runners.name: Stellar Swift
runners.owner: Lily Chan Li Lei & Marc Chan

prev_owners.owner: Lindsay Park Bloodstock, J S C Chua Et Al

runners.comment: Capitalised on drop to Class 4 last month; needs more in this higher grade
runners.spotlight: Back in the winner's enclosure when capitalising on drop to Class 4 over 7f last month; will need to find something extra to strike in this higher grade.

runners.name: Tier Fly
runners.breeder: Sheikh Mohammed Bin Khailifa Al Maktoum
runners.owner: Dr Irene Lau Mun Yee, Lo Yat Fung & Francis Lo Chaten
runners.comment: 2-9 in Australia; ran on nicely when asked for effort in his penultimate barrier trial
runners.spotlight: 2-9 when based in Australia; ran on nicely when asked for effort in his penultimate barrier trial; any market support should be noted.

runners.name: Regal Gem

prev_owners.owner: D Bishop P Robinson S Bland T Coyle

runners.comment: Took a step backwards over C&D last time; still early days and may bounce back
runners.spotlight: Encouraging start to local career with two respectable runs, though took a step backwards over C&D last time; still early days and may bounce back.

runners.name: Charming Babe
runners.comment: Broke his local duck in February; held off a higher mark in three runs since
runners.spotlight: Broke his local duck over today's trip at Happy Valley in February; held off a higher mark in three runs since and needs to raise his game to figure.

runners.name: Savvy Warrior
runners.comment: Not disgraced in two local appearances but hasn't threatened; outside place contender
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced in two local appearances but hasn't threatened; needs to take a big step forward to land a blow in this company; minor honours perhaps best case.

runners.name: Lucky Sweynesse
runners.breeder: P L Dombroski, Explosive Breeding Ltd & S A Sharrock
runners.owner: Cheng Ming Leung, Cheng Yu Tung Et Al
runners.comment: Former champion; fair absence after long absence latest; badly treated by race conditions.
runners.spotlight: Four-time Group 1 hero who won this race in 2023; returned from 13 months off to finish sixth (6.5l behind Helios Express) as a 25-1 chance over C&D five weeks ago but was found to be lame the next day; up against it on much worse terms here.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Sprint (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I had the run inside Victor The Winner but when James [McDonald] went for him, he shifted in and hampered Lucky Sweynesse a little bit but he accelerated so quickly, I was able to come out across his heels and he had his chance from there - he did what he had to do. I love him - Zac Purton, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Sprint (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Wrong gate. I said to Manfred (Man, trainer) after the draw, we're going to get stuck on the fence from there and not get out - Zac Purton, rider of Lucky Sweynesse, speaking to HKJC.

runners.name: Helios Express
runners.comment: Placed in three C&D Group 1s this term; deserves a win; is no good thing at these weights.
runners.spotlight: Has come up short, but run with great credit, in no less than seven meetings with the mighty Ka Ying Rising this term; finished at least 2l in front of seven of these rivals over C&D last time but is now 8lb worse off with four of them.

runners.name: Lucky With You
runners.comment: Dual 2025 C&D winner; had excuses last time; 0.5l behind Helios Express the time before.
runners.spotlight: Weakened late when behind seven of these last time but may have paid the price for chasing the invincible Ka Ying Rising too hard; just 0.5l behind Helios Express on 1lb worse terms over this C&D in March.

runners.name: Victor The Winner
runners.comment: Possible leader; has lost his way since landing shock C&D Group 1 win in January 2024.
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to Lucky Sweynesse in this race two years ago; winless since making all for shock C&D Group 1 triumph 16 months ago; no sign of revival since moving to current trainer two starts ago.

runners.name: Patch Of Theta
runners.comment: Six-time course winner (including Group 3) but always over 7f or more; lacks speed for 6f.
runners.spotlight: Peaked when landing 7f Group 3 on New Year's Day; solid effort when 1l second off 1lb lower when last seen seven weeks ago; all his best form is at 7f and beyond so unlikely to be effective over this trip.

runners.name: Magic Control

prev_owners.owner: Carringbush Park Syndicate, Miss K A Brideoake & M D Laurie

runners.comment: Fair recent runs in Group races but even that form gives him a little to find; best at 5f.
runners.spotlight: 2lb out of the handicap; improver this season (won off 9lb lower in February) but is well held by two of these from his latest handicap run and might be better at 5f.

runners.name: Invincible Sage
runners.comment: In the doldrums prior to C&D Group 1 fourth as big outsider latest; better treated here.
runners.spotlight: Much his best run in ten tries since landing a C&D Group 1 13 months ago was when finishing fourth (2l behind Helios Express) as a 125-1 outsider five weeks ago; repeat of that run on 8lb better terms would give him major claims.

runners.name: Mugen
runners.comment: Possibly best at 6f; even the level of his two recent fourth places needs improving upon.
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since 7f Group 3 triumph 11 months ago; better efforts the last twice but needs to take another step forward from that form to get competitive here.

runners.name: Copartner Prance
runners.comment: 6lb out of the handicap and is racing from 12lb above his highest winning mark here.
runners.spotlight: Seven-time 6f winner but has struggled in all three previous tries in Group company and will find things hard today from 6lb out of the handicap.

runners.name: Beauty Waves
runners.comment: Out of the first two in eight runs since Group 3 victory; 9lb out of the handicap.
runners.spotlight: Winner of a 5f Group 3 in October and has acquitted himself well in the face of some stiff tasks since; behind six of these last time and hard to fancy from 9lb out of the weights; headgear removed.

runners.name: Ladys Choice
runners.owner: Hk Association Of Lady Horse Lovers Syndicate
runners.comment: In top form at a much lower level; likely to be outclassed from 16lb out of the handicap.
runners.spotlight: Six-time C&D scorer who has taken a major step forward with two victories in recent weeks but those were at just Class 3 and Class 2 level and is 15lb wrong in the weights today.

runners.name: Crossborderpegasus
runners.comment: Three short-priced, narrow wins; awkward head carriage; now blinkered; up 7lb and from 6f.
runners.spotlight: Only a short head reverse has stopped him from boasting a perfect four-from-four start to his career; 7lb higher than for his latest head C&D win; has not looked an easy ride; now tried in blinkers and up from 6f.

runners.name: Aeris Nova

prev_owners.owner: C Bennett, Flying Start Fine Scent Et Al

runners.comment: Beat Crossborderpegasus in March, now 4lb better off; two fair runs since; up from 6f.
runners.spotlight: Beat Crossborderpegasus on 4lb worse terms over 6f three starts ago; two staying-on relatively narrow defeats since, suggesting this extra furlong will be a plus.

runners.name: Everyones Star
runners.comment: Comfy 0.75l C&D victory last time; up 7lb; Purton has chosen him over Crossborderpegasus.
runners.spotlight: Broke his Hong Kong duck at the fourth atempt five weeks ago over this C&D by a cosy 0.75l; now 7lb higher; Zac Purton (who was on Crossborderpegasus last time) rides for the first time.

runners.name: Withallmyfaith
runners.comment: Newcomer who won three minor 1m races in New Zealand; failed to sparkle in local trials.
runners.spotlight: Hong Kong debutant; half-brother to two winners out of a six times successful sprinter; won three times over 1m in New Zealand but at a modest level and has not stood out in two local trial races.

runners.name: Yuen Long Elite
runners.owner: Friend Of Yuen Long Merchants Assn Syndicate
runners.comment: Two front-running seconds since C&D win off 11lb lower; should again prove hard to catch.
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; twice a runner-up since easy C&D winner in first-time blinkers off an 11lb lower mark in January; well drawn and improving but Purton (aboard for latest win) looks elsewhere.

runners.name: Keen Molly
runners.comment: Expensive yearling who won twice in Australia but has not impressed in four local trials.
runners.spotlight: Gelded since arriving from Australia, where he fetched AUS$2,250,000 as a yearling before winning twice and finishing midfield in a Group 1; his four local trial runs have been disappointing.

runners.name: California Bay
runners.comment: Eighth (beaten by just 3l) on recent 6f local debut; should progress and be suited by 7f.
runners.spotlight: Second in both Australian 7f outings; sent off at 24-1 for 6f local debut and ran respectably from a wide draw to finish a never-nearer 3l eighth of 12; improvement likely over this longer trip.

runners.name: Ka Ying Attack
runners.comment: C&D winner in December; weighted to reverse recent 6f placings with Crossborderpegasus.
runners.spotlight: Began his career with three good efforts (two wins) last year; back from a break, after a pipe-opener he was 0.5l third to Crossborderpegasus last time (6f); now 7lb better off.

runners.name: Sea Chariot
runners.comment: Killarney 1m handicap score who may take a while to settle in to his new surroundings.
runners.spotlight: Irish import who was successful in three of 13 runs for John Joseph Murphy, most recently a 1m Killarney handicap on heavy ground; no evidence in three local trials that he will be ready to win here.

quotes.race: Torc Travel Handicap
quotes.quote: Sea Chariot doesn't have many miles on the clock. We weren't sure about the ground today, but when I gave him a chance he got into a nice rhythm. He didn't ride like a slow horse - Colin Keane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Sea Chariot was fresh today but they went a good gallop which suited. He's a horse that will pay his way up here for the winter - Shane Foley, rider.

runners.name: Cheval Victorious
runners.comment: Would be a shock winner here following three modest efforts since arriving from Ireland.
runners.spotlight: Offered little in three outings (6f then 7f) so far; needs to show much more to enter calculations.

runners.name: Target Audience

prev_owners.owner: M Keesom, J Heasley Et Al

runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.name: Big Return
runners.comment: Has showed little in three runs (5f & 6f) at huge odds since arrival from Singapore.
runners.spotlight: Singapore import who was a down-the-field outsider on his first three Hong Kong starts; up from 6f.
